Thank you again April for your help with this matter.
Thank you. Don and Sheri Thompson

header: Please consider booking through other channels
body:
I have a short term rental and AirBnB has made up 70% of my bookings. At some point in late 2024, the bookings stopped. I am now nearing the summer when my unit is usually very booked in advance, but I have only bookings from VRBO and Booking.com and I am only 30% booked.
There is nothing wrong with my listing, no complaints, high reviews, free cancellation, and my prices are lower than comparable units. Yet, my unit is not showing up in search results and AirBnB is not helping me find out why. This issue, which seems arbitrary and algorithm related, could force me to sell which is likely to lead to a big loss of tens of thousands of dollars. I am pleading with them now to let me talk to a manager to help dig into what is happening with their search algorithms and they seem unconcerned.
AirBnB takes high fees, has no protection for hosts, and yet expects us to keep using their platform. I am already using other channels and they just don't have the same volume of guests coming through. I implore potential guests to look at other ways to book - try VRBO, Booking.com, Google... There's a lot of options, let's diversify so we don't end up maintaining this monopoly.

header: Account Suspended after attacked in…
body:
Account Suspended after attacked in Airbnb.

I was literally sitting in an Airbnb rental when the door was kicked in by a drug addict and I was attacked.  I effectively defended myself using a kitchen knife.

Police arrested the drug addict and concluded that it was a proper self defense.  I was released within two hours, only to have Airbnb permanently close my account due to 'safety reasons'.

Not only that but they cancelled all my reservations from all my guests for my own home, even though the attack took place in a totally different country and had nothing to do with the listed home.

I literally sued and they settled out of court for $4k.  They refused to unsuspend the account but said I could open another, so I did.

About a month later, without talking to me or explaining, they instantly tossed my guests out again, calling them at 2am and demanding that they leave, then suspended the second account also.

header: I want to share the worst experience…
body:
I want to share the worst experience I’ve ever had with Airbnb. Renting an Airbnb in Brazil turned out to be my biggest mistake.
Being human, I offered shelter to a friend at 4 AM, someone who was not included in my booking. My host, who constantly monitors his camera, saw this and took issue with it. The very next day, without even giving us 12 hours to pack, we were told to leave immediately for violating the policy of having a fourth guest not listed in the contract.
To make matters worse, the refund we received was only 30% of the total amount, despite the host previously stating it would be 50%. And Airbnb, acting as an intermediary, did nothing to help. Even squatters are given 48 hours to find accommodation, yet as paying guests, we were treated like criminals and thrown out onto the street.
Simply put, Airbnb has the worst customer service imaginable, and I regret ever using their platform.

header: The property was not as nice as in the…
body: The property was not as nice as in the photos - pretty dingy. We couldn't bear to stay there even one night, so left and stayed in a hotel. The owner refunded some money but this is my first and last Airbnb experience - be warned that review inflation is rife and there's no guarantee your property will be as described.

header: BAD AIRBNB!
body:
BAD AIRBNB!

My host cancelled with less than 48 hours to go. This was nice house at Cudjoe Key, near Key West. We had airline tickets, and thousands of dollars of activities paid for, and my granddaughters were ready to go, so I had to find something else. Well, Key West is a super hot spot for Spring Break. Airbnb offered to help and then suggested three alternative rentals: one would have cost me an additional $15,000, one was $10,000 more, and the last one was a trailer--a trailer! So, I found and equivalent house. It was $3000 more, which is pretty amazing for Key West during Spring Break. Airbnb only gave me $873.52, so I was out of pocket $2214.13 to get the new rental. I told them that it wasn't fair and they should cover the full amount...but I would be happy splitting it with them. They refused. IN MY OPINION THAT IS NOT FAIR. I reserved an paid for a house...I should get one for the money I paid.

BAD AIRBNB!

header: Cancelled booking
body: Booked though air bnb. 10 days before my holiday the host cancelled the booking. If you're looking for secure bookings air bnb isn't where it's at.

header: The platform is just annoying
body: The platform is just annoying. From verification procedures to communication, everything about the platform is just frustrating. In my opinion, the entire platform is a complete failure. The only reason it is so widespread is simply that it was one of the first platforms of its kind. The customer service is terrible and doesn’t understand a word. Even the verification process alone takes a really long time. I am thoroughly and extremely dissatisfied with the entire platform.

header: Deeply Disappointed by Airbnb’s Inflexibility During a Family Medical
body:
We booked an Airbnb on September 2, 2024, for a planned family vacation scheduled for July 12–19, 2025. Sadly, just two weeks after booking, my mother suffered a seizure and was diagnosed with a glioblastoma brain tumor—a devastating and aggressive condition.

While we initially hoped she’d still be able to make the trip after surgery and treatment, her condition worsened. My father canceled the reservation on February 24, 2025—well within the host’s posted policy, which stated cancellations made by July 5, 2025 would receive a 50% refund of nightly rates and cleaning fees.

Since we had only paid 50% of the total cost ($6,213.82), we expected a refund of that amount. Unfortunately, that didn’t happen.

The host, Tory, was unwilling to work with us. My father offered medical documentation—she declined. She originally said we’d receive a full refund, then later claimed she was unaware that Airbnb’s payment plan policy overrides her posted cancellation terms. Eventually, she said we’d only get a refund if she’s able to rebook the week—no guarantee, just a conditional promise.

We were then told by Airbnb that because we used a payment plan, we were not eligible for any refund, despite canceling well in advance and within the stated policy window.

I spent over two hours on the phone with a kind and empathetic customer service manager, who admitted our situation warranted a refund. But he ultimately said he couldn’t issue one due to internal policy restrictions.

This experience revealed a serious flaw in Airbnb’s system: there is no clear, compassionate process for families dealing with real emergencies—even when the host’s terms suggest otherwise.

Instead of support, we were met with rigid policies, conflicting information, and a host who changed her story. We’re not asking for special treatment—just basic fairness and human decency. Airbnb failed us when we needed compassion the most.

I’ve reached out directly to Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky in hopes that he’ll step in and do the right thing for our family.

header: Review Not Being Removed Despite Providing Evidence
body:
The support team confirmed that the review could be removed, but due to a technical issue, they were unable to process it at that time. For days, I have been explaining that I have evidence proving the review is unfair and that a support agent has already acknowledged this. However, the review still has not been removed.

According to the new policy, only a team called the "Special Team" can handle such cases. However, there is no direct way to contact them. They only provide a form link, and despite submitting it multiple times and informing them about it, I keep receiving the same generic response. It seems like everyone is repeating the same scripted replies, and it is impossible to find someone who genuinely takes responsibility for the issue. If you are treated unfairly, you are simply left to deal with it, with no real solution in sight.

header: AIR BNB Beware
body: I am a faithful AIRBNB customer.  In general, it works.  However, I had a host cancel 2 days before a reservation was due to start, putting me in a tremendous bind and cost in me $700 additional dollars to get the only remaining property that met my needs.  I cannot review the host, and while AIRBNB states that it will “cost the host”, that have no consideration for the person who has been cancelled.  I managed to wrangle a small amount of compensation from AIRBNB, but there is not nearly enough protection for renters.  They had the use of my money for that reservation for a full year and cancelled with impunity.  Beware!!

header: Think before hosting-I've been a host with them for over…
body:
I've been a host with them for over five years now, and I've definitely learned a lot along the way! One thing I’ve noticed is that the focus often seems to be on the guests. 

For instance, there was a situation where a pump broke down due to unforeseen circumstances, and the guidelines they have—what they call "community standards"—were used to navigate that challenge. I had a guest who decided to take off his trousers and insisted on staying, even when I needed to assess the situation because of a burst pipe caused by the dry season. Although Airbnb offered him the option to relocate, he felt there wasn't enough communication from their side.

In the end, I made the decision to cancel his reservation, which I felt was the right choice. 

Unfortunately, this isn’t the first bump in the road I've faced. During Covid, I had a guest who left quite a mess, and while I received only $80 in compensation, I was faced with potential repercussions myself. Sometimes it feels like the fees can be quite high as well!

Overall, while there have been challenges, I still find hosting to be a rewarding experience!

header: Website glitch left us minus £400
body: Airbnb website glitched and closed our payment deadline 2 days early - this meant we lost half of our payment and the booking was cancelled. Contacted customer support and was told it was up to me to sort it with the host, even though it was airbnb's error. Host refused to refund or rebook us, so theres £400 down the drain. Never using Airbnb again - booking.com is better.

header: OMG I had NO IDEA AirBnB was so bad!
body:
OMG 
HOW I wish SOMEBODY would create another VERSION of AirBnB that was STRICTLY based HERE  with U S employees!!! I just spent 30 minutes on the phone with 2 people in call centers in some 3rd world country with next to NO command of the English language trying to explain that I needed to change the form of payment for an 8-MONTH reservation that starts in 2 weeks. 

Between the times I was on hold and the times I was TRYING to decipher what the first guy, and then his female supervisor were saying after I explained the situation to then SEVEN TIMES, I could've rented an RV and just lived in THAT for the 8 months!

Then lo and behold I come here to Trustpilot, where I ALWAYS verify my gut feelings about any company I'm dishing out more than 5 bucks to, and find their average review here is LOWER than 2 outa 5 ?!?!?!?

I should've come here FIRST!!

header: TERRIBLE!
body: TERRIBLE!! Airbnb let's hosts hide additional fees in sections of their website that are only visible after the booking. HOW TO GET INSIDE is such a place. Eventually after hours of hassle in the middle of the night,  Airbnb agreed to pay the hosts hidden fees. This is going to be my last booking ever!! with Airbnb.

header: I would give them zero if it were an…
body: I would give them zero if it were an option. Although you book via Airbnb therefore your contract is with them, they hold no responsibility for false advertising, they do not provide a refund and confuse you in a web of multiple conflicting communication to make you give up. I recommend booking.com or Agoda.com for a professional service. Greed is driving Airbnb. And do complain to your credit card companies and small claims court as it’s the only way Airbnb will start to care.

header: They don't stick to their own Terms of Service
body: A letting company used Airbnb to rent their property. Novasol asked me for more than the agreed cleaning fee after I paid on Airbnb by sending me over to their own lettings website where they asked for a bank transfer before arrival. This goes against Airbnb's Terms of Service but Airbnb wouldn't return all of my money due to the deceitful host's cancellation policy.

header: Loss of super hosting status due to not selling more than 10 trips a year despite 5*. Madness!
body:
Well well I knew they were not popular in certain quarters but these ratings says it all. I am writing as a host though I have used them many times as a guest too. 
Airbnb look after themselves and only themselves! Sound familiar? Sure I’ve heard that in the news about someone else recently 🤣. They have recently removed our super host rating for no good reason. 
Their thinking is that now we have dropped from 4 to one property with only a summer season to let ( ie 12 weeks or so) we do not meet their silly criteria anymore whereby one must rent more than 10 visits (1 day or 2 weeks makes no odds) per year. Our Villa is sold out all summer mostly by Airbnb but many bookings are 2 or 3 weeks so we don’t meet their target! 5* or not, (we actually had 5* on all our properties until we sold them short while ago) we no longer qualify. How crazy is that? Won’t be with them for much longer me thinks, especially in view of these customer ratings it looks like there is little point anyway. Shame, was once a good company.

header: All the reviews are true
body: All the reviews are true. Airbnb user for more than 10 years and i have constantly been in a position where Airbnb side with the host. It is not fair and have even been provided false information by Airbnb staff that had benefited hosts. I urge you to lower your usage of this app and find alternatives. Very bad business practises and extremely unethical company. Customer service is non-existent, and if i could give a 0 rated score i would! Shameful and despicable service.  Airbnb are alienating their customer base and i have started to move away from this app! Stick to booking.com or other alternatives.

header: Unreliable
body: Twice now had a booking cancelled after confirmation. This time, just 3 months before the holiday! Very very poor.

header: No stars for airbnb, DO NOT USE avoid these thieves
body:
If I could rate Airbnb no stars I would, and absolute sham of a company, reviews of apartments all mixed together so you don't know if the review is for the right apartment or not.
Been waiting over 2 weeks for them to process a refund and keep getting lied to as to where it is. The apartment we stayed in was not as advertised.
Will never use Airbnb again, and I would recommend noone else does either, bunch of criminals.

edit 20/03/25 - I am still waiting on a refund from airbnb it has now been almost a month since they supposedly processed my refund and yet nothing has come from them, they say the issue has been escalated and an engineer is looking into the problems but getting nothing from them, at this point I'm not expecting to ever see this refund, complete and utter bunch of criminals.

header: My protest against insanity
body: Airbnb has always been my go to place for holiday accom and i have no complaints about their service, but I am unwilling to support a US business while the country is being run/ruined by a bunch of self serving lunatics who are not nearly as smart as they think they are, with no interest in helping those who actually voted them in to power or supporting democracy worldwide. This is my protest vote....

header: SCAM!!
body:
SCAM!!! If I could give zero starts I would. Shocking customer service just pasting the same messages and wasting time and not solving anything. 
SCAM!!!

header: The fine was given with little to no…
body: The fine was given with little to no clear explanation, and when I reached out for clarification, the response was slow and unhelpful. There was no proper warning or chance to correct the issue before being penalized, which feels more like a money grab than a fair enforcement of regulations

header: Can’t believe they’re still in business!
body: We were traveling for our anniversary. It was discovered that the house we were staying in had a roof leak, soaking our mattress and both beds had bugs in them! We, two size grown adults, were attempting to sleep on a couch covering with a bath towel because we didn’t want to use their linens (bed bugs). We were communicating with host, then at 11 pm contacted ABB, they said they’d get back to us within an hour. At midnight I sent ABB a message that we’re going to pack up and start driving across the island (in a third world country), making our way to a more touristy area to find a place but was hoping we heard from them prior to know the plan and because of spotty service. No word from ABB. At 1:30 am I called ABB and they said they’d “escalate the situation”. In the meantime we had people knocking on our window as we drove, didn’t want to roll the window down, also didn’t want to make them mad. Couldn’t just “drive away” as we had to drive slower than we could walk because of the DEEP pot holes in the narrow roads. We didn’t end up hearing back from ABB until the next morning. We ended up sleeping in our car, in a parking lot, in a third world country. They never did assist us in finding a different place. We did find one for our last night. We have been hosts for ABB for 3 years, 5 star super hosts with lots of reviews. I can’t believe they would leave any human stranded like that! How are they in business????

header: Appalling support service from air BnB…
body: Appalling support service from air BnB my advice DONT BOOK

header: The CFO is part of DOGE
body:
The CFO is part of DOGE, I travel frequently as does my family. I will never utilize this service again. You corporate fat cats are gonna figure out real quickly that we are the reason you have money, and
we will be the reason you won't.

header: Complete s##t show.
body:
Complete s##t show.
I'm hoping for the days of registered b and bs to come back. These guys are getting worse, causing homelessness was bad enough.
I am not one for expecting others to be responsible for when things in my life go wrong. Equally, I am responsible and considerate to others, especially business owners. I had two more breaks booked for this week. However,my phone went missing on Sunday. Due to the snowball effect of this, and I have learnt a pricey lesson...do not get over dependent on your phone, I cancelled one booking and got half back. The second place,I decided to reschedule the booking for a longer stay, really to give hosts more business for the inconvenience.This was a place where you could pay a deposit then the full amount. 
However, Airbnb demanded the full amount straight away. I explained my situation,but they wouldn't have any of it. Just a sickly apology. This was after needing to get past a stupid virtual assistant. What they do is get you to write a message,then a virtual assistant gives a completely unrelated response. Then you have to write another message. I then got a message saying that they had tried to ring my lost phone. It would be a great world if you could still use your lost phone. Are we on planet Zog???
In the end I had to do a cancellation, making me 70quid out of pocket for this one . OK,yes, what happened to me is not anyone else's problem, but seriously,would I have paid just short if one hundred quid on Saturday to intentionally lose it the next day. Come on. I then got a series of repeat messages not making any sense. The final straw was, quote, 'I hope this finds you well'.... passive aggressive smug arrogance. Why don't these organisations drop the disingenuous figures of speech???
Needless to say, after the final booking I have in April,I won't be using them ever again. Also,their fees are absurd. You get charged cleaning fees when no cleaning is done. Like most of these free Enterprise companies now, there are just the few who benefit. I'm not being chippy, Id rather have little but have a moral compass.
Don't tell me they will ask me to contact them on social media. This is breaking data protection,where's the privacy here?

header: We stayed in Jupiter beach condo
body:
We stayed in Jupiter beach condo,  The place has stained carpets, torn sofa, shower doors falling off, and the worst was they adveristing 3 blocks from the beach, it was well over a mile and Air bnb will not make the host change the ad.  I have photos etc.  The condo is call Jupiter Beach Palm Suite, Host is Ricky 
Registration number
000027437, 2023152995

header: Airbnb Treats Hosts Unfairly – Zero Transparency
body:
Airbnb’s handling of experience removals is completely unacceptable. My experience was deleted without warning, without explanation, and without any chance to fix whatever so-called issue they claim exists—even though it had great reviews and followed all Airbnb guidelines.

When I asked for details, I got a copy-paste response with zero useful information. Meanwhile, similar experiences remain live on the platform, which makes this decision feel biased and unfair. It’s beyond frustrating to see Airbnb prioritize certain hosts while shutting down others without justification.

As a small business, we rely on platforms like Airbnb to connect with travelers, and their lack of transparency and total disregard for hosts' efforts is disgraceful. If they can remove a well-established experience overnight, who’s next?

header: Just don't
body: Just don't.  Our reservation was cancelled for no reason.  We are trying to get our $5,000 back and will wait the 72 hours for a credit, like they stated.  If not we will have our attorney contact them.  We spoke to someone who was polite, but her accent was so thick we could understand hardly nothing.  I have never had an experience like this.  It was our first time with AIRBNB and our last.  AS I said, JUST DON'T

header: Lack of humanity in it's business model
body:
It seems like the Airbnb customer service team has zero motivation to genuinely resolve issues and rather their main goal is to diffuse or sweep issues under the rug.

Most of the owners I've dealt with recently have been money hungry and complained in a rude manner about having to clean a dish or 2 after my departure, there's no air of honorable hospitality or good faith that seems to be coming from this company. 

I can see how the world will move back to using the hotel industry more as hotels are set up for a hospitable stay that serves the guest.

Airbnb could have been successful had they maintained people friendly values but that's gone out the window..

header: Awful experience
body:
Awful experience following and a disappointing stay. 

Arrived at accommodation after a 3 hour drive to find the shower not working due to the head being dirty, the shower was electric and the switch was wired incorrectly as you needed to turn it to stop for hot water and then the cold setting to turn it off. 

The Tv and remote didn’t work either which was also reported.

The host came out and cleaned the shower but text to explain they couldn’t sort the tv until the last day which was too late and with having 3 kids this wasn’t great. The host claimed everything was fixed and I provided proof it wasn’t but they offended me by saying the favoured the host. 

In addition I sent evidence of units which should have be fixed to walls as they were very unstable and light weight with one falling over and cutting my daughters eye plus a shower curtain which was a tension bar and also very unsafe. 

If your stay is fine then all is good but if you have an issue then don’t expect them to both reading your evidence as they will only ever favour the host. 

Will not use again!!!

header: Review policies...
body:
As a long-term SuperHost with consistently high ratings, I expected Airbnb to uphold its own policies when handling guest disputes. Unfortunately, this experience has made it clear that Airbnb prioritizes guests over loyal hosts—no matter how unfair or dishonest the situation is.

I received a 1-star review from a guest who was polite and happy until I filed a reimbursement request, as Airbnb itself recommends hosts do. After this, the guest’s tone completely changed—they falsely accused me of racism and even implied they would steal from my apartment. Despite providing clear evidence that this review was written out of retaliation, Airbnb refused to remove it, violating their own Review Policy.

To make matters worse, customer support was abysmal:

I was called for only one second, and when I called back, no one answered.
Every response was copy-pasted and dismissive, ignoring my actual concerns.
My case was closed repeatedly without any real engagement with the facts.
The first thing people see on Airbnb is a host’s review score, so this one malicious, false review has damaged my status as a SuperHost. Airbnb should protect experienced hosts who follow the rules, not punish them for doing what Airbnb itself recommends.

If you’re a host considering Airbnb, be aware: they will not protect you. If a guest decides to leave a false, defamatory review out of revenge, Airbnb will do nothing about it.

Airbnb needs to start enforcing its own policies fairly and stop stonewalling dedicated hosts who are the backbone of their platform.

header: Unprofessional assistance for safety issues
body: Airbnb claims that their safety policy is a priority. The reality is that when an unfortunate incident occurs, Airbnb's support is very superficial in understanding the issue accurately and providing effective assistance. If something serious happens, you are completely left on your own.

header: Terrible host experience!
body:
I’ve been a dedicated Airbnb host for years, maintaining a five-star rating and receiving overwhelmingly positive feedback. Unfortunately, my entire listing was suspended after just a few less-than-perfect reviews—even though one of them contained inaccurate information that misrepresented my service. I filed a formal complaint, but Airbnb’s support channels have not addressed my concerns fairly.

This sudden suspension has had a huge impact on my livelihood. It’s disheartening to see how one or two outlier reviews can override a long history of excellent hosting. Even worse, the current policy seems to place all weight on a guest’s perception, without balancing it against objective performance metrics or verified evidence of a host’s consistent quality.

I’ve asked Airbnb to review my case thoroughly, but the lack of transparency and slow response have been extremely frustrating. Despite my loyalty and proven track record, it feels like Airbnb disregarded my side of the story and took action that doesn’t reflect my overall performance.

If you’re a host who relies on Airbnb for income, beware: a few disputed reviews might be all it takes to jeopardize your listing—even if you’ve worked tirelessly to keep guests happy. I sincerely hope Airbnb improves its review policies and offers more balanced, transparent resolutions for dedicated hosts like me.

header: Don’t trust reviews
body: Not to be trusted, you put in a complaint and it goes nowhere. I’m not sure who they’re protecting the host or their customer. I even produced pictures and nothing was done about it. They closed the case out. The host offered $140 back if I would not write a bad review apparently we don’t have to worry about it because they won’t post my review. I wish I could post the pictures and you decide if you would stay there.

header: Unfair, biased dispute process against false damage charges
body:
We recently had a terrible experience with Airbnb, where we were wrongfully charged $368.86 for alleged damages after our stay. Despite having no proof that we caused the damage, Airbnb automatically sided with the host and attempted to charge our credit card without our consent.

Why This Is Unfair:
	1.	No proof of damage: We repeatedly asked for time-stamped photos or other conclusive evidence that we caused the alleged damage, but Airbnb failed to provide anything substantial.
	2.	We already paid $2,228 for our 3-night stay at a rate higher than the market price – This included a $140 cleaning fee, yet Airbnb still attempted to charge us an additional $100 for “extra cleaning.” This seems like an unfair way to double-charge guests.
	3.	Zero fair dispute process – Airbnb’s dispute system is one-sided. Guests are held liable without real evidence, and once Airbnb makes a decision, there is no proper way to appeal or escalate the case.
	4.	Stressful, biased & unethical practices – Airbnb clearly favors the hosts over guests throughout the process. This experience has caused significant emotional and physical stress as we have been forced to fight an unfair charge instead of enjoying our trip. Airbnb’s handling of this has made us question their customer service and trustworthiness.

Beware Before Booking on Airbnb!
	•	If a host falsely claims damage, Airbnb may automatically charge you without proof.
	•	Even if you dispute it, Airbnb’s system is stacked against guests.
	•	Their customer service offers no real recourse—once they decide, they ignore guest complaints.

We will not use Airbnb again unless they change their policies to protect guests from false or unfair charges. If you’re considering booking, be aware that you could be held liable for damages without evidence or a fair process to defend yourself.

We strongly urge Airbnb to:
✔ Stop charging guests without sufficient proof.
✔ Revise their dispute process to allow fair appeals.
✔ Provide better transparency in damage claims.

If you’re reading this, think twice before booking on Airbnb! They prioritize hosts over guests, even when the claims are unfair.

header: After years of loyalty to Airbnb I am…
body: After years of loyalty to Airbnb I am done, sadly. I have 3 reservations left and I will see those through. I made a reservation in August 2024 and sent a message in February 2025 to the host with a question. I received no response so I called the number on the listing. The host said they had no idea why it was listed on Airbnb. I called customer service and they made a few phones calls and cancelled my reservation. The hotels in the area are now 3 times more expensive than when I booked and all Airbnbs are booked. Airbnb didn’t care and didn’t offer me anything to try to compensate. That was shocking to me. They blamed the host and took no responsibility. It is a terrible way to treat customers.

header: Review process is shocking
body: Review process is shocking,  and is in favour of guests and not the hosts! I tried to get a review removed and they struggled to see how it violates their own policies. They have no idea what they doing!

header: Awful experience where the ambassador…
body: Awful experience where the ambassador did not even know why my review violated review policies.

header: Terrible, impolite, argumentative customer service!
body: Just terrible service.  I've been with AirBnB for 8 years and they held up a booking (which I then missed) to "verify my ID" - even though my ID is fully verified.  Terrible, argumentative staff jerked me around for 4 hours while they were completely unable to solve the problem.  I just made a full-week reservation for over $10K 3 days ago that went through without a hitch, so clearly my ID has been verified.  Terrible, terrible, inexperienced, impolite, argumentative, incompetent customer service!

header: I am a host and have noticed that my…
body: I am a host and have noticed that my settings keep getting changed. Airbnb customer service says no they aren't - total gaslighting. They say the change isn't showing up. Well of course not! The system itself is changing it! I blocked off several days a week ago and have had to block them again 2 more times because the system opened the days! Their system also changed my cancellation policy! I only now took a screen shot of the blocked days so we will see if the system changes it yet again!

header: THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE
body:
If I could give the less than zero I would. I was unfortunate to encounter a very rude host by the name of Guliver Apartments. Where I realized I was about to get scammed into an unfavourable property I cancelled the order. 
Thereafter this host spent a week sending me all sorts of insults, harassment a d threats 
I reported this to customer service several times and they tried to sweep it under the rug and even closed the ticket I opened without so much as a call. It's been 3 days now and Airbnb have done nothing to resolve this whilst the host still keeps sending me harassing messages and indignant insults.
Disgusting and shocking. I wonder if AIRbnb is this nonchalant about complaints or is it just cause of my geo. 
Next I will be sharing screenshots of the entire conversation online.

header: super expensie and not clean
body: super expensie and not clean

header: Airbnb ignores it’s own rules ?
body:
Had a confirmed property booking cancelled. Owner received a ‘too good to refuse ‘ offer and sold the property. 

No penalty for the owner from  Airbnb despite not on their list of major events allowing cancellation .

So presumably it’s o.k. for guests to cancel against the published rules and also suffer no penalty

header: Airbnb Aircover is a LIE
body: Airbnb Aircover is a lie. I am a host and one of the guest made damage to my window frame, airbnb only paid 1/10 of the quotation from the window supplier and since then has not response to the case. I have tried to contact them many times and all the cased are closed without notification. If you are a host, you need to think carefully when/whether you want to host in airbnb without any protections.

header: Not the best experiences
body: I have stayed in a couple of properties but they were not the best.  I still have some future reservations so who knows?  I have just received a cancellation for a room booked in Naples in May, i now have to find alternative accommodation, so this has finally convinced me to go back to Booking.com.  I know they are not perfect, but i have had good experiences with them and found them fair to deal with.

header: Cyclone Alfred is due to hit and we can't get a refund after being forced to cancel
body: I'm currently arguing with Airbnb to try and get a refund for an $1800 booking that we have no option to cancel because the area where we are due to stay (the Gold Coast) is literally about to get hit by Tropical Cyclone Alfred. Airports have shut, flights have been cancelled, there is a government-issued request to not travel, all businesses are shut. Yet according to Airbnb this doesn't meet the requirements of their Major Disruptive Events Policy. These people are absolute crooks. All of us affected by this are boycotting Airbnb here on in.

header: poor customer service
body:
poor customer service 

Went to place a booking for 3 guests. "Unauthorised Party" was flagging when attempting to make any reservation. Even tried to book for 1 guest and still flagged as unauthorised party. Messaged the host directly to be told she had no problem with me staying and I was provided a link to book as I have stayed before. still didn't have this random restriction lifted from my account making me look flakey as opposed to the app. 
Created a new account to honour my promise only for the malicious AI to detect that I already had another account. still couldn't book unauthorised party!!. I then Raised a case through their support only to be told to not create a new account rather than addressing the actual issue. New hosts missing out on bookings because of AI behaviour thinking I'm trying to organise a rave. Shouldn't the host be given the option to accept a potential booking if I've messaged them to clarify that it's ok on their end to book again + with 3 guests? I had tried to reserve another flat earlier in the week however nobody responded to my request but this was completely overlooked by their software.
Support then clarified that "weekend last minute bookings" constitutes a party even though I tried to book flats earlier in the week but nobody got back to me and my booking were cancelled. it's a 3 bedroom flat to house 3 people? Do not think this is very fair on the hosts completely unaware people are trying to book their apartments. The AI should inform the host, not make the decision for them.

header: I was bitten by fleas
body: I was bitten by fleas, @ the Airbnb apartment I was staying in , in Troon Scotland. The apartment was on 24P Bradan Rd Troon. The Landlord, was an absolute nightmare, & actually threatened me, by insisting I move out, because he didn,t like what I was saying about his apartment! The bed was horribly uncomfortable, I could feel the mattress springs pressing against my back! I spoke to about 15 people @ Airbnb about the problem, & each time I spoke to a different person, & had to go over the whole story over & over again !They also wanted proof about what I was saying! The landlord was trying to damage control by saying there were no fleas! why then was my body covered in bites, & did I have to see a pharmacist to get hydrocortisone cream, & antihistamine tablets?The whole stay, was a complete nightmare!The Landlord @ one point threatened to come to the apartment, & evict me despite still having a contract with me that he refused to cancel!2 days after I left, the apartment was being advrtised again on Airbnb!?!! What are the consequences for his threatening behaviiour? I was travelling alone, so single female traveller 68 years old, being threatened by an Airbnb Landlord. I felt very unsafe! Have never been treated by any previous host in this manner. Do not have anything to do with a Landlord named Alan Quinn. (He now advertises, using a company name!)

header: Customer Service Stinks
body: I have been on the phone all day with Airbnb customer service. I could not find my reservation and every time I tried logging in the site said my account was not verified or my cell phone number was linked to another account. So I called customer service and the girl could not speak English very well. So after 35 minutes I asked to be transferred to a supervisor. She told me it was against company policy to transfer me since I was not verified!! I said that’s why I’m calling but I cannot understand you and you obviously cannot understand me since you keep asking me the same questions. I’ve given up with this company. There are plenty of other rental sites.

header: Beware before booking with Airbnb.
body:
Beware before booking with Airbnb.
After not using them for 2 years, I booked a night in Austin last night. I booked an airstream camper. First it said it was in Austin. It was not. It was 25 miles from Austin. Second there were I think 5 campers and the photo in the listing was nothing like my camper. The door was wide open when I arrived almost 3 hours after check in. When I went inside it smelled like urine and what I guess were suppused to be beds were unmade stacks of foam. It was gross. Chickens running around, we're in Texas out in the country and you leave the door wide open? Long story short airbnb resolves it and refunds me. Then they encourage me to try again and give me a $50 coupon. Great!
Ok. So I try again tonite.  Things got strange pretty quickly. The host sent me a questionnaire asking me if I had partys, would sign an agreement not to have party's and my reason for being in Austin. Yes. They sent this THREE times. After the third time I told them perhaps we should just cancel cause i've answered you 3 times and you seem uncomfortable. Then they say there is a $300 deposit or $35 waiver fee. Why wasn't this charge or offered when Ipaid for my booking??? The after 4 hours of waiting they say they can't confirm until I pay the waiver fee. THEN SEND ME TO ANOTHER SITE OFF OF AIRBNB TO COLLECT MONEY AND ASKED FOR MY ID. ID THAT HAS BEEN VERIFIED BY AIRBNB. 
I calle airbnb to cancel at 1pm today to tell them how upset I was consideing what happened last night. First, she told me never to put personal information on an outside site. She said someone was on it and would get back to me. I wait until 5pm and no call. Meanwhile the host calls. Again I sent the host a message through airbnb that Iwas cancelling. have had 4 calls with airbnb today and the host. The last rep just told me that it is now Airbnb policy to allow the host to collect money from you after you have paid to book, on another site. This person asked me for my drivers license on another site. NOT COOL. Head uo folks, this is not good. I'm sure Iost the money but glad I didn't give my information to these people. It sure feels like a scam and I told airbnb just that. They say no scam. This is exactly what happend to me during that Amazon anydesk scam. Now I understand all the bad review for Airbnb. Another great thing gone bad due to sheer greed. Airbnb does not have your back.

header: Airbnb is not recommended
body: Airbnb is not recommended. I had very negative experiences in 2 of the 3 properties I paid for. The last property was unacceptable & I lost nearly $400 on a place I had no intention of using. I will only use Airbnb if I am able to view properties before paying. It's just too risky compared to hotel & motel stays.

header: Disgusting customer support
body:
Airbnb’s customer service is an absolute disgrace. They are completely unresponsive, ignoring my case for over a month while refusing to address my legitimate refund request. However, when it comes to falsely charging guests for damages without any solid proof, they act instantly.

They were trying to wrongfully charge me $350 for so-called “damages” with zero real evidence—just close-up photos that don’t even prove where or when the issue happened. Airbnb didn’t provide any valid invoices or repair receipts, yet they still sided with the host, showing a complete lack of fairness.

Meanwhile, my valid refund claim for a broken bathtub and a missing workspace—both clearly misrepresented in the listing—has been completely ignored for over a month. I’ve contacted Airbnb multiple times, and all I get are empty promises that someone will “reach out soon.” No one ever does. They simply close my support tickets without resolving anything.

Airbnb has proven to be a dishonest platform that prioritizes hosts over guests, even when the hosts are clearly in the wrong. Their customer service is utterly useless, and their so-called “dispute resolution process” is a joke.

I will make sure to warn as many people as possible about their shady practices.

header: support is not answering
body:
host canceled last minute. airbnb suggested me other "similar" options that were way too expensive and way out of my original budget. when i requested a refund they dodged my messages. they straight refused to communicate with me anymore. i still dont have a refund, no apartment for my trip and airbnb is not answering back on my messages either by email or support chat.

this is the first time in my life a website/service support system is refusing to communicate with me and not refunding me.

header: Had a case open for weeks where nothing…
body:
Had a case open for weeks where nothing was ever followed up, lots of false promises and robotic replies.

Phone calls were useless too. 

Was promised they wouldn't attempt to take money from me as I proved with the host it wasn't necessary, but after air bnb promised they did so. 

Slow, robotic replies, never gets passed to "speciality team" - they are just as incompetent as everyone else.

body: The verification process is this company is idiotism. I have had profile for 4 months, again booked apartment here, and my country of registration and ID is Colombia. They banned my account forever, you know why? - Because my place of live differs from the country in which I'm currently tourist. idiots suka. let them die, DON'T USE AIRBNB

body:
rental in Swaziland :
We were 4 in the villa, I want to give a review as a guest but only the person who reserved the booking can do this despite the fact I have the name, reservation n° and all the details.   This is not good for Airbnb

header: I had a case open with them and I kept…
body: I had a case open with them and I kept getting generic answers from them, I was looking into getting a partial refund for a miss represented listing and they were really hard to deal with. They kept asking for pictures but items advertised in our listing were not there, how to you take a picture of something that's not there. Eventually they just closed the case. Complete waste of time

header: Avoid Airbnb – Unreliable, Costly, and a Complete Disaster
body:
I used Airbnb six times in the last two months, and on three separate occasions, I was left stranded because the host either didn’t respond or failed to provide access to the property. This resulted in enormous last-minute costs for me, completely defeating the purpose of using Airbnb in the first place.

The worst experience was on New Year’s Eve in Paris. I arrived at my Airbnb and attempted to contact the host numerous times, receiving no response. I was left standing outside in -4°C for hours, desperately trying to find alternative accommodation. Given that it was one of the busiest nights of the year, every hotel was either fully booked or outrageously expensive. It wasn’t until nearly 1 AM—five hours later—that I finally found a single room available, which cost me €300 more than my original Airbnb booking. The next day, the host finally responded, casually explaining that she had moved apartments and no longer lived at the address. How was this listing still active? How is Airbnb not verifying that their hosts still own or have access to the properties they advertise? They charge enormous fees—what exactly are they for if not basic verification?

The second and third failures happened within 24 hours of each other.
On one occasion, I arrived at the Airbnb at the designated check-in time, called and messaged the host repeatedly, and received no response for hours. I was forced to book a last-minute hotel late at night. Later, I found out the host had been sick and “fell asleep.” While frustrating, at least it was an explanation.

However, the next night was even worse. I had booked a hotel through Airbnb, which had a 24-hour reception, so I assumed nothing could possibly go wrong. How wrong I was. After traveling across the city in a taxi, I arrived at the hotel to find a tiny sign on the door stating: “Closed for one month for renovations.” I had made the booking almost exactly one month prior—meaning Airbnb had allowed me to pay in full for a completely shut-down hotel. How does that even happen?

Each time, Airbnb refunded what I had originally paid, but that did nothing to cover the hundreds of euros in additional costs I incurred. I booked through Airbnb to try and save money, but in the end, it cost me far more than if I had just booked hotels directly.

I will be uninstalling Airbnb and never using it again. My advice? Use Booking.com or any other platform. I’ve never had issues with them, and after this absolute disaster, I wouldn’t trust Airbnb with a single cent.

header: Difficulties booking
body:
Never had problems before but trying to book and there is a new verification process. Impossible to use. Spent over half an hour going round in circles. Very poor.

I'm also very nervous about providing confidential information like a passport, especially since it is an American company where you can't be sure that your privacy and confidential data is properly protected.

header: Flex pricing is a rip off
body:
Found a great place for a group of friends. I sent them the link to have a look at.
Airbnb saw all the interest and put the price up!!
So I went direct to the host and got it for the original price..
If you are looking for a place to share, don't share the airbnb link - just copy the details and send those.

header: Welsh AirBnB way below standard of other platforms
body: We have booked 2 properties in Wales and both were lacking. We have had great host in the 1st one, so we've overlooked maintenance issues. 2nd stay was horrific, really dated property, not following basic H&S (electric heater and extension lead in bathroom!). We have raised issues with host and were faced with harrasment over messages, to the point that I had to turn volume on my phone- I was bombarded with messages late into the night, even when I have asked her to stop and told her I was dealing with AirBnB support. Howere, the support seems to be for the host only - as a guest you are completely ignored, even after raising safety issues. Messages from the support team were also hostile, demanding additional payments, even though we've paid in full!! We are still waiting for a refund as we've only stayed 2 out of 5 nights ( no property heating or hot water during Feb in Wales). And if your review is honest they just remove it. We will definitely never use this booking platform again, as there are cheaper and safer options.

header: After many years spent as a happy…
body: After many years spent as a happy customer, today I am felling super disappointed by Airbnb for taking the part of a fraudulent host Who claimed damages for something that never happened. From today onwards I will be the worse advocate of Airbnb and I will never use this service anymore.

header: They just don't care
body:
They are monopolist who are always on the host side. Their customer service takes days to reply with generic "sorry" message.  GO DIRECTLY TO YOU CREDIT CARD COMPANY if you faced unfair charges or issues with refunds.
Airnb would not do ANYTHING to stop hosts blackmailing me to leave a 5 star review to get my moneyback (which I didn't) for the properties that I had to run away from because it was locked in unsafe neighborhood that was advanced as"safe". Airnb stated they didn't have a policy to handle this issue. 
Renting from them is a gamble.

header: I notified AirBnB that a host reached…
body: I notified AirBnB that a host reached me outside Airbnb for a deal and their response was hideous. Basically they weren't willing to do anything about it which is a red flag for the host and Airbnb as well.

header: Abysmal customer services
body: The most shocking customer services ever! Had a negative review from a host in retaliation to me complaining about their false advertising of their property. They blatantly lied about various things and said we stole cushions, and left the place a mess. We certainly did none of the things they claim. Air b and b refuse to take down the bad review. They won’t even investigate which is a minimum they should do. They just state the host complied with their review policies so all is good in their eyes! I’m flabbergasted a company can operate like this…

header: I have left a negative review about a…
body: I have left a negative review about a guest who destroyed my house and of course they deleted it because I violated something, but they won’t say what I have violated.

header: Air B&B Las Vegas host Hope at MGM Grand
body:
You can’t leave a review to warn other customers of a bad host  if you cancel your reservation. Additionally the 50% cancellation fee is extreme.i had a cancellation request 27 days before going on my trip (event was cancelled) and they took half of my fee anyway. No support from the host or from Air B&B either. Don’t pay the full amount up front if you have to use hosts that do this, 

The host I had was in Vegas. Accommodate was at MGM Grand. Named Hope. Rude snd unhelpful.

header: 24 hr locked out losses booking fter many successful years as an…
body:
After many successful years as an AIRBNB Host  am dismayed by a situation thar has arisen which they were unable to resolve and lost me and a client a 5 night booking. And I'm prevented from letting my room to anyone else for that period.
Basically they locked me out for 24
 hours which was after the time 
limit to respond to the request. To add insult to injury they send me reminders and messages throughout that period including early hours of the morning despite the fact I could not click on the link to read them, 
Customer serviced went to Great lengths to confirm my ID (which is what I'd failed to manage to log in and led to the 24hour block.) They could see m account was blocked and the outstanding booking request but told me that they were powerless to help. And their only advice was to wait 24hours. 
I cannot even complain to them about this as yes you know what I'm going to say ....my account is locked 24 hours every time I try to log in!I hope they read this and amend their system to cope with this situation in future.!!

header: Availability is not always as it seems and vouchers complicate
body: I had a problem as airbnb were advertising a property as available but when I booked it did not go through, although I had paid upfront with Blue Light Card vouchers.  Customer service is time consuming, and not the most helpful responses initially.  If you use vouchers they make you pay more deposit and then when things go wrong it is hard to resolve, although eventually it was sorted out.

header: Airbnb listings in Georgia
body:
Airbnb listings in Georgia, Mississippi, and Louisiana promoted cottages with "authentic Southern charm." Guests called them "beautiful," "peaceful," and "cozy." In reality, these were former slave cabins—historical sites turned into vacation rentals.

Update: Reports reveal that Airbnb and Booking.com facilitate profits from illegally occupied Palestinian land.

header: Jonas Host for Bossa de Botafogo| Rio de Janeiro
body:
Details of this Airbnb is an apartment hosted by Jonas and co-host Brenno in Botafogo Rio de Janeiro, Brazil!

Beware of where you stay this host was very rude and violated community guidelines by not giving me the code for the apartment at least 2 days prior and Airbnb let him get away with it!

The host only allows for POSITIVE reviews on his profile!

I wrote a fair review and he got Airbnb to remove it, I then tried to get my review reinstated and they told me I was being manipulative and coercive and violating community guidelines, which is completely untrue and they kept it deleted! 

This is my fair review:

The apartment was decent but it had lots of problems, But mainly the host was the issue, very unhelpful and causes a lot of stress. Will refuse to give code to the apartment until he wants you to have it and not 12 hours before like Airbnb states. Very inflexible, so if you need something please contact Airbnb instead of them. And honestly rude. The shower drains has worms constantly crawling out while you have a shower. A bad smell as you enter the lobby, and although the apartment was clean, the pillows smelled awful. We had to wash them ourselves. Along with lack of ceiling fans ( they are there but don’t work.) sockets unfinished, right side of aircon unit broken. And no green space at all ( as stated in the listing) along with a smell from kitchen drain. I’ve noticed he has denied and sent hateful messages to other people who left a bad review without addressing any of the issues stated. So if anyone has questions please reach out. We have photo and video evidence.

header: be careful they evict without reason during your stay
body: I rented an apartment in Spain. During my stay I found problems and opened a dispute. Airbnb did not solve my problem but simply cancelled the booking and demanded that I leave the apartment immediately. I asked what the reason was for the eviction and they replied that they could evict without reason at their discretion. That is, they evicted me without reason. They did not return all the money spent. I will avoid this company for the rest of my life and I advise you all to do the same.

header: Bodily fluids in the hot tub, host accused me of the state
body: I just got back from a stay that has left me feel violated and it's not okay. I've reported it to Air BnB and of course they are on the hosts side. The host has provided evidence (clearly old) and I have provided evidence of how it was when I got there. Absolutely disgusting that involves bodily fluids. I've asked for a refund but the host has been rude and abrupt and Airbnb will only offer a partial refund.Honestly, avoid this company. Crooks!! They aren't user friendly. Avoid, avoid, avoid!!!

header: Airbnb are facilitating rogue Hosts.
body:
Airbnb are facilitating rogue Hosts.
We recently returned from an Airbnb accommodation.
It was completely falsely advertised. It was listed as a "Luxury Villa" but was in a bad state of repair, without working bath, severe internal damp issues, no working locks on exterior doors and was dirty with the rubbish of past guests.
Airbnb have ignored our obvious evidence and their duty to provide the services we paid for as described on the listing.
They have refused any refund or compensation for the bedding and cleaning products we had to purchase to make it livable.
The photo evidence is unquestionable but they and the Host are collaborating to deny our legitimate claim.
We will never use them for anything in the future and are now in the process of taking them through the UK Small Claims Court.

header: I have 6 houses with Airbnb and have…
body:
I have 6 houses with Airbnb and have only ever claimed once before, which was honoured.  Claimed £100 as a guest smoked weed, took drugs, etc and I could not let it out for 2 days due to the smell.

They grind you down with the admin to the point where it is not worth the hassle.  I'm sure it is a deliberate ploy to stop payouts.  You may as well go to Bookings and VRBO, who at least have no pretence that you are insured.

header: They are very good at taking your…
body:
They are very good at taking your money, but useless at providing any help.
Will never use again

header: First time of using (guest)
body:
First time of using (guest). Family members have used many times. Booked ok - used the app. 
Summary of long boring story - unable to access the property (host apologised and promised refund). Air B&B useless, didn't understand issue despite screenshots and are refusing a refund for a property we couldn't access. Oh ... and I got a positive review from the host apparently I left it clean and was quiet. Yep, that will happen when you don't use a property.
I accept things go wrong, however, resolution is impossible and I would not use again. If you do have an issue it will not be dealt with. Incredibly frustrating.

header: AirBnB thieves
body:

We will never work with them again. Disgusting behaviour.

header: I left 1 but 0 would have been more…
body:
I left 1 but 0 would have been more accurate. I had a gues from he'll who moaned about everything from day 1. We contacted airbnb and they said don't worry - we are here for you... we'll they are not. Don't host with them. 

We've lost £1,800 (airbnb have paid them despite writing and confirming  they didn't provide enough evidence)
