body: how can a host just cancel without any comeback or without even being able to leave a bad review?  Let down once more by airbnb, won’t use again.

header: It is fake app and first time money…
body: It is fake app and first time money accepted and say give me more review then accepted money otherwise return it....so be careful everyone....time wasted app

header: I have to give half way stars on this…
body: I have to give half way stars on this company because I had to cancel the remaining of a trip after one day due to plans changing and I did get the problem resolved quickly by AIRBNB and already received a refund quickly with no hassle from the company itself. My complaint is that the hosts of the homes where I have stayed seem to want to vent about their financial situations and are quick to ask you to move in with them for long term or permanent because they are mostly over living their financial means and see you as a bank to support them rather than a guest in their home. I do not want the pressure of someone begging for money and that's what it is. I suggest people doing AIRBNB to make extra income start using their profits for necessary things instead of throwing away what they make and trying to live in a house that's not in the rich area and trying to keep up with the Joneses next door to impress them because if you are a host spending that money on your week family vacation instead of doing repairs to your house.. that's really not my problem.

header: Appalling Customer Support
body:
I can only reiterate what other people have said in their reviews.  The support for hosts is terrible.  

I have been an Airbnb host for 11 years.  Until about 3 years ago, I was very happy with them.  Recently they are charging more commission and providing appalling service.  

Their support staff are willing but they are clearly totally untrained and unable to deal efficiently with any problems.  

In the last six weeks I have had 3 major issues with Airbnb.  The last is a shortfall in payment to me of nearly €4500.  I have been unable to resolve it with Airbnb but have been fortunate that my guest is honest and we have settled the debt privately.  

It is also incredibly frustrating that the company has no complaints process.  One can give feedback but there is no record of it, and no one replies to it.  They just say a team will work on it.

header: Use another platform, poor experience with AirBnB
body:
I came here to write a review and I’m surprised at the amount of low rated, customer reviews there are.

Our host cancelled our accommodation on the day, 5 hours before checking in. We were already in the area, and therefore decided to call AirBnB to support. 

We had booked a 3 bedroom house, as it was for 6 adults. 

AirBnB decided to find ‘similar’ places, an supposed 6 adults to stay in 1-2 bedroom properties. They sent over a few listings which seems to be 1 room with multiple beds. No further help was given from them, just a £20 voucher that I did not want.


- Poor customer service
- Clearly intelligently chosen agents in asian countries paid low, they sound very robotic and no clue how to help
- I won’t be using AirBnB anymore, it’s safer to go through alternative sites like Booking.com or Expedia.

header: Airbnb blaming a victim for reporting abuse on host. We were physically attacked by host and we provided the evidence.
body: We were physically attacked by the host during our stay, The host entered the property with it's own keys and started attacking us physically. We called the police who made sure we are safe, until we leave the property with the child and the small dogs. We submitted video of the host attacking us to Airbnb, who seemed to be supporting at the beginning but the next day, they have blocked our account as there was a violence during our stay. We were the victims and we were punished by Airbnb for reporting about the host. I am very disappointed that what me and my family have suffered and that the situation was allowed to stand by Airbnb. They clearly don't care about the safety of the guests. This Airbnb host should never ever be allowed to list his property anywhere. After this situation we found out that this host was blocked by booking . com, so clearly it was not his first time.

header: Wish I could give 0 stars
body: Wish I could give 0 stars. Airbnb is the worst company I have ever worked with. They are rude, had no clue what they were talking about and siding with the host when I clearly have pictures, videos and text messages to prove I did everything the right way. The place was disgusting and when I was packing my basket accidentally hit the air conditioner and the cover fell off, let me just say the amount of mold inside that unit was enough to make anyone sick. The lock was broken when we got there, the fridge temp wasn’t consistent, complained everyday, bedding was never changed from the previous guests and the ac was FULL of mold! Never again!!!

header: Stopped enjoying airbnb and deleted…
body: Stopped enjoying airbnb and deleted account- there are many other websites with similar properties to rent on.

header: Negative reviews are not published
body:
A lying review of the owner is published, while our review with all our complaints - and for which we opened a case at airbnb, and left the rental apartment - is not published.

Nice way of doing, seems airbnb forgets who’s the payer,

header: Unfortunately once more the help center…
body: Unfortunately once more the help center seems not being well trained and efficient. Moreover, the Air cover never works when you need it. Airbnb keeps changing the terms at its profit and frequently fails to protect the hosts which are Airbnb's source and main and only content along with experiences organizers. Airbnb proves to be a dying platform which only cares about its profit. Lastly they keep too much of service fees while their services are keep getting poorer

header: Unfortunately once more the help center…
body: Unfortunately once more the help center seems not being well trained and efficient. Moreover, the Air cover never works when you need it. Airbnb keeps changing the terms at its profit and frequently fails to protect the hosts which are Airbnb's source and main and only content along with experiences organizers. Airbnb proves to be a dying platform which only cares about its profit. Lastly they keep too much of service fees while their services are keep getting poorer

header: Awful robot customer service
body: Awful robot-scripted customer service claimed they had sent 3 prompts/ reminders for me to review the host that had slagged us off but airbnb hadn’t and provided no proof. Airbnb is an utterly vile company to deal with as the abysmal rating here shows. You can see they simply wouldn’t be able to keep up with the deluge and tidal wave of unhappy customers.

header: Swanston House, Langport, Somerset
body: The house was immaculate,  well presented and very welcoming. Mark, the host, was there to meet us on the day.  He has thought of everything, you truly only need to take your clothes and food.  We had a wonderful family week there, seven adults, two children and a baby, it worked so well for us.  Lots of space and plenty to do, both at the house and near by!  Definitely 5 stars from all of us. Highly recommend it 😍

header: Our room was cancelled just one week…
body: Our room was cancelled just one week before due date so we couldn't find anything in the same price range and we had to move out holiday few days further. We were given £21 (joke)credit with expiration day lasting 3 days ( another joke). Customer service unhelpful.

header: Airbnb has the worst customer service…
body:
Airbnb has the worst customer service and force you to waste many hours and weeks to get your money back. Spent $17,000 on a two week stay and had to leave after one day due to the house being dirty and disgusting. There was a pet snake that was not disclosed and the homeowner wanted us to feed and clean out cat litter. I’m not picking up cat poop when I’m on vacation. The home was filthy and not fit to be rented out. Worst off all the home owner lied on their review of me. I will never use Airbnb again. Terrible customer service and they allow host to leave dishonest reviews.
Airbnb offered to put me in another place but when I inquired they said the offered expired. I am still waiting on Airbnb to honor their word.

header: Pick another home sharing service
body: Airbnb makes a big deal about protecting guests with their "AirCover" policy but if the host repairs whatever physical issues there are they will not even consider granting you a refund for other issues, such as a psychopathic host who walks in to a private space without knocking or without warning, who harasses you time and again to leave for a few days so they can finish some painting and tub sealing in the middle of the stay, who text you at 10pm to say they'll be coming by at midnight to deal with some trash they left there, etc. 3 times through support and all they do is read a script, tell you they'll look into in and then NEVER EVEN REPLY OR CALL BACK. They don't care how dirty and run down a place is (no ventilation in kitchen or bathroom, for example) and don't even get me started about the extra fees they allow hosts to charge outside of the agreed rate. And don't trust the superhost label... you cannot trust it.

header: As a host I got screwed up by Airbnb
body: As a host Airbnb screwed me up with a drug adict lady who vandalized and destroyed my brand new home and brand new furnitures and they offered me $147 as compensation. Their customer service is terrible. It's just an app with a bunch of irresponsible kids from overseas. I have taken down all of my listings and won't use Airbnb again as a host or traveler. I'll look for other ways to travel and rent my properties.

header: worse booking site
body: two months ago j booked an apartment then cancelled by the host. Still not refunded, it seems they have no intentions to refund.

header: A Traveler's Nightmare: How Airbnb Failed to Protect Me from Assault
body:
**Review of Airbnb: A Cautionary Tale of Safety and Accountability**

I am writing this review to share a deeply troubling and horrifying experience I had with Airbnb. As a single woman traveling in a foreign country, I expected a safe and secure stay when I booked through Airbnb. Unfortunately, my experience turned into a nightmare.

During my stay, I was physically attacked by the host. In a state of shock and fear, I immediately reported the incident to Airbnb, believing they would take swift and serious action. I was sorely mistaken. Instead of receiving the support and protection I needed, I was met with a bureaucratic nightmare.

Airbnb initially promised to investigate the incident. However, I was continuously given the runaround, with no real updates or progress. A week later, to my utter disbelief, I received an email stating that my account had been blocked. No further information regarding the assault was provided. This response was not only inadequate but utterly insulting, considering the gravity of the situation.

I am disgusted by Airbnb's treatment of my case and their handling of such a serious incident. It is clear that they prioritize their hosts over the safety and well-being of their guests. As a traveler, you expect the platform you use to take responsibility and ensure your safety, especially in a foreign country where you are most vulnerable.

I strongly urge everyone to avoid using Airbnb for their accommodations. The company's inability to protect its guests and their blatant disregard for the severity of assault is appalling. Safety should always be a top priority, and Airbnb has failed miserably in this regard. Do not put yourself at risk; choose a company that values and safeguards its customers.

header: BAD AIRBNB EXPERIENCE
body:
Hi,
I would not recommend renting a AIRBNB in Atlanta Georgia, we booked  Wed, Jul 10, 2024 Sun, Jul 14, 2024 an Entire home/apt · 7 beds · 10 guests they mostly post fake pictures of the rooms. they posted as Gated Modern Home 15min away Atlanta. Be careful the airbnb was dirty , full of ants and mice ,and was never clean when we got there, we had a hard time speaking to customer service and getting our full refund , so be careful if you decide renting from them, I will NEVER RESERVE FROM THEM AGAIN !!

header: Airbnb customer service is bad
body:
Airbnb customer service is bad. Paying with a credit card is a nightmare, they ask you to talk to your bank when you can buy anywhere online with tthe same card without a problem.
Trying to reach customer support is worse than you think.
And the prices are getting really close to a hotel. Airbnb is an overprice hostel.

header: Amazing Window View 2Room Apartment by Andel Metro
body:
DON'T. BOOK.

(The title is the Airbnb so you do not book him)

Me and my 2 closest friends decided to travel to Prague, and need an apartment for 2 nights. We saw Cyril's flat, and since the price was relatively cheap, we booked it, as well as paid for the cleaning fee, beforehand.

From the start, it wasn’t apparent that Cyril was playing a facade, continuously acting super-generous and easy to contact. He dropped by the apartment and helped us sign some immigrant/vacation-papers, he even pointed out that we should feel at home, and we “of course” could use the necessities we needed. More about the apartment in the last paragraph.

The 2 nights pass by, and we message the owner that we’re leaving. And even though we had already paid for the cleaning, we still fixed and made the fixing, easy for him. Including throwing all trash into bins, hanging the towels back, leaving the glasses in the sink, and making sure nothing was out of place.

Fast forward 3 hours, and we receive an additional request of about 4000 CZK (about an 50% extra of the total fee), for “additional cleaning”. He attaches images of a bottle, a sock and glasses being in the sink, and claims 1800 CZK for them being out of place. 1800 CZK. Furthermore, he attaches images of (according to him) one 5-year old sleeping blanket with a green/ turquoise stain and a black mark (that easily goes away in the wash, since blankets should be washed after usage), and claims we are responsible for the stains. We agree on that the black stain might have come from some type of spillage from a drink, so we agree that we could pay, if the stain doesn’t go away in the wash. 

Cyril adds two more images, of normal dirt on two different towels. It must be quite apparent that if there are hanging towels in the bathroom, they will be used? Do we have to pay extra 500 CZK, for towel usage? Especially when, it’s just normal, dirty towels? 

The apartment itself was relatively similar to the pictures and description on the site, but I find it kinda confusing that the silverfish, insects, garbage outside the main door, the odor from the stairwell that goes into the apartment, the lift that almost breaks every time you need to enter the 5th floor, the shadiness of how you gather the keys, the graffiti on all walls when you take the stairs, the windows that needs to be forced open if you want some type of oxygen, the lack of air conditioning, or the disgusting smell that’s coming from the bedroom? He must have forgotten adding it to the description. Thinking back, we are convinced that neither the sheets, towels or anything that needs to be cleaned, has been cleaned before arrival.

If it isn’t clear, this is a risk NOT worth taking.

I'm writing this one because Airbnb deleted my comment on Cyril's account. So if i manage's to save one from experiencing what happened to me, I'm happy. And the reason I'm giving Airbnb 1 star is that they deleted my comment where I complained about my stay and they left his comment filled with lies up on my profile, which will result in complications with my next stay.

Poor customer support on this one, if this happens to you, document everything and if you suspects your host of being shady. Please take a photo of the place before you leave. We did not and we had to pay for that sadly...

header: Horrible customer service
body: Horrible customer service. They just ended my booking without any consultation whatsoever. Highly NOT recommend AirBnB as a host for renting out your house.

header: Airbnb's website is a total mess
body:
Airbnb's website is a total mess. You literally have NO WAY of searching for a location on their main page. Example: if I want to search for a room in Boston, there is no option to do that anymore (online website, don't know about the app).

At this point, the best way to find a place to stay is VRBO. Their website is still easy to use.

Whomever changed Airbnb to this mess should be fired immediately. What a total idiot. What's even worse is that no one at Airbnb has caught this monumental blunder.

header: Most horrible company ever
body: Most horrible company if you every need to make use of customer service. You call with one department and the next day the other department calls you with zero information. They dont provide any proof in case of damage claims, they just ask for proof that you didnt make any damage. i have had emails from one department saying i dont have to pay, and then the other department sends an email i do have to pay. Worst customer service in my life. it took me over a month and 15+ calls to resolve a fake damage claim of the host. and in the end, you cant even write a review about the host because the term expired. you send screenshots of proof to you department, and then the other department has 0 knowledge about anything. what a headache. Booking.com is 100% better in their customer service and i will never book on airbnb again and i will shout this story from the top of the highest hill to prevent anyone i know to every book with these people ever again

header: Unethical and unregulated
body:
As a loyal Airbnb customer for over 10 years, my recent experience with Airbnb's handling of a negative review left by a host has been profoundly disappointing and frustrating.

I booked a stay at Night Pastures in West Sussex, where the host provided a non-functional contact number, failed to deliver essential information through the Airbnb platform, and encouraged us to leave reviews on external sites like TripAdvisor. These actions, which violate Airbnb’s own guidelines, led to significant communication difficulties and a very unpleasant stay.

Despite my numerous attempts to resolve these issues through Airbnb support, including providing evidence and clear documentation of the host's violations, my concerns were initially acknowledged, and the negative review left by the host on my profile was removed. However, without a satisfactory explanation, the review was later reinstated.

The host’s negative review criticised me for excessive messaging and late arrival—issues directly caused by the host’s own shortcomings. This retaliatory review unfairly tarnished my reputation, despite the host being at fault. Airbnb's support team initially agreed with my concerns, but then inexplicably reversed their decision, reinstating the unfair review.

This back-and-forth process, filled with misleading assurances and unfulfilled promises, has been extremely frustrating. Airbnb's support team has shown a lack of accountability and regulatory responsibility. Furthermore, their suggestion to respond to the review was redundant, as I had already done so.

The behaviour of both the host and Airbnb in this situation has been unethical, reflecting poorly on Airbnb’s commitment to maintaining a fair and trustworthy review system. It is clear that genuine customer concerns and loyalty are not valued, and this has left me reconsidering my future with Airbnb.

I expected more from a platform that I have trusted for over a decade. This experience has been a stark reminder of the importance of accountability and customer support, both of which Airbnb has severely lacked in this instance.

I hope this review helps others be cautious and highlights the need for Airbnb to revisit its policies and customer service practices to truly support and value its users.

header: Opened a air bnb account and tried to…
body:
Opened a air bnb account and tried to book an apartment with two rooms for myself and my friend that is travelling to London. Automatically rejected due to an issue that cause I am male 46 and booking two rooms then I am going to have an unauthorised party. Anyone else experienced this? 
Unfortunately I will not be using air bnb in the future.

header: complete waste of time booking anything in advance these days
body: used many times over the years but lately it appears that hosts are able to up the prices or cancel the booking with no consequences. The last 3 bookings I have made well in advance have all been cancelled by hosts closer to the date, even after requesting immediately after booking, that the host acknowledges the booking and confirms. This is simply so that host can obtain a higher price for the booking, each of the cancelled listings have immediately been relisted at higher prices and each of the hosts has tried to insist that I cancel the booking myself so they receive no fees. Airbnb help centre is absolutely terrible and offer no resolution. Each time I have had no alternative but to book another option at inflated prices, closer to the date. customers has zero rights and no guarantee of booking even after paying in full

header: What a load of bologna on rye bread!!!
body: I had to cancel our reservation due to family members not being able to get time off with their jobs. We had gotten a $400 credit and nowhere does it say that we couldn’t use the credit towards the new reservation’s deposit. When going to book I see that the $400 was coming off of the TOTAL amount and not the deposit. I had called Airbnb and got the run around 3 different times. One person said it can’t be used, another time it can be used. Which one is it? It shouldn’t be this hard to use MY MONEY however I please when it comes to booking. Of course Airbnb doesn’t think so. Even if you cancel your account the credit STAYS and isn’t refundable. I’ve used them several times in the past but this made me steer away for sure. They’ve really gone downhill.

header: Its 1am of morning
body: Its 1am of morning. I did a reservation at 7pm, and I am literalmente sleeping in the street because Airbnb. Just 3rd World this enterprise.

header: They steal your money worst company ever
body: Tried to book using £4000 worth of Airbnb vouchers. Apparently something went wrong. No villa booked now Airbnb have stolen my money. Phoned, talked on live chat and all the time been lied to by the service centre staff. Pushed from one employee to another all with no answers and reading from very bad scripts. Absolute joke of a company don't ever book through them because they steal your money.

header: My family and I recently attempted to…
body:
My family and I recently attempted to book accommodation through Airbnb and found a listing that seemed perfect for us. Fortunately, we didn't pay immediately, as it turns out that recovering our money would have been impossible due to the platform's policies, and we would have lost our money.

Airbnb allows dishonest users to post listings with misleading prices. Had we paid for this booking, we would have been forced to pay extra. I want to emphasize that we filled out the booking form correctly. However, when we contacted the host, he informed us that the listed price was irrelevant and that the actual cost was double. He then suggested we book directly through his own website.

When I reported this to Airbnb, they simply thanked me for the information and sent me guidelines on how to book correctly. I already know the rules, which is why I reported the violation in the first place. It seems Airbnb doesn't care that their site hosts listings that violate their own policies, putting customers at risk. Instead of addressing the issue, they pointed us to their rules, even though the problem lies with Airbnb.

My wife and I used to frequently book through Airbnb, but now we will need to find a new platform. This experience has completely shattered our trust in Airbnb.

header: And once again airbnb customer service…
body: And once again airbnb customer service continues to suck. I’ve been on the phone three times with them and still no one can tell me what community standards I violated. Apparently that department only communicates via email which never comes. Fascinating how they can tell you when you’ve done something wrong but can’t tell you what. A bit hard to address an issue like that

header: Insurance not excising …
body: Overall I find the airBnB a good platform but only if you don’t have any issues. They promise the world with the insurance. I have had two cases both as a host and as a guest and every time they have treated me like a child… and off course with no solution?!?

header: Life endagering
body: They have put me in an unsafe position. Bc of their host, I had to wait alone in the middle of the street from 11pm until 12.15am and when I contacted them to help me they said they will review my complaint in 24h.

header: Very disappointing experience
body: Although Airbnb had been paid in full for two separate places in Italy, as a courtesy I let them know my purse, with credit cards, had been stolen. Within a minute my bookings were cancelled. So, in Italy without credit cards and no accommodation. Was there on my own, as my partner had died suddenly two months earlier. Emailing Airbnb was a waste of time as nobody had the ability to understand the circumstances.

header: NEVER USE AIRBNB
body:
NEVER USE AIRBNB. It is the worse hospitality platform. NEVER TRUST HOSTS especially Borges in Barcelona.
Reservation was confirmed so we went and bought plane tickets(longhaul flights), ferry tickets and hired a car, for the host to just cancel the reservation the next day without any explanation. I still haven't received full airbnb refund and I have no idea where we are staying now and I can't get a refund for any of the flights/ferries and car reserved.

header: Airbnb don't care about the hosts
body: I am a host and I am extremely disappointed by Airbnb. Airbnb charged me around £1200 for a non specified issue dated 2022 so 2 years after. Airbnb gives discount to any guest without consulting the host and this for ridiculous and non - justified reasons. I don't recommend.

header: Great proactive customer service
body: Great customer service, proactively reached out to me and helped with my reservation issues - the communication was clear and everything was resolved by them in a few hours, I didn't have to do anything.

header: Wouldn’t ever use or recommend AirBnB to anyone.
body: We stayed at a property and received a good review from the host. Then a couple of weeks later we received an email asking for additional monies for damaging a bed we slept in. The AirBnB so-called resolution process found us responsible for this damage on the basis of a photo that actually showed that the bed was not installed correctly and had broken at sometime as a result of this. If we had broken the bed it would have been something we would have been aware of it breaking of no matter the actual cause … and this did not happen.

header: False advertisng encouraged
body: They allow false advertising and even encourage.  They allow you to post TV even if it has no function.  Not smart, not capable of apps, no cable, no antenna just on and off.  Same with dryer in unit.  If it is there but non operational it counts as dryer in unit.  Even though policy says they will find comparable place if something is wrong like filth nothing.  No help at all

header: Worst Experience with Rentals. Period.
body: We had a place reserved in Georgia for a vacation. We live in California and were planning to visit family and Tybee. The Crowdstrike IT outage downed so many planes that so many travelers had their plans canceled. Our plans got changed by the Airline at 5am on July 23. The host would not allow us to request a refund for the place after July 22 at 4pm. We got the text about 12hours later that our flights were changed and on top that there were no flights we could take as a back-up. We canceled so many plans and EVERY OTHER BUSINESS from car rentals to hotels all understood the situation and how unique it was and gave us refunds. These also were after the date that generally they would allow a refund, but again after explaining the situation EVERY ONE of the other business agreed this was unique. Joseph our gracious host however replied only twice despite me trying to explain our situation and ask is there anything he could work with us on. Even if he offered 50% refund that would have been a nice gesture. But no he refused and simple wrote to me the cancelation policy each time in a copy and paste method. I filled a formal complaint with Airbnb and they did nothing. They kept saying we can try other routes of obtaining you a refund. I asked what were those routes and each time was given a run around about how we can review those methods if the host refuses. Well he refuses and Airbnb simply said we tried everything. I now realize that anyone who went through what we experienced was unable to review Joseph as you are not allowed to tell others of your experience when this happens. There is no method. Airbnb will protect its hosts over its customers every time. I think we should wake up and use our money to support those individuals worth supporting and those that want to better our communities not those out to make money off of others misfortune.

header: Airbnb does not protect hosts OR guests
body:
Airbnb does not protect hosts.  Had guests that trashed our house, broke multiple rules like having pets and smoking inside, left food, dirty kitchenware, and trash just everywhere and all these things explicitly against the house rules.  While there, the guests refused to answer managements calls and texts about these things . . . because they didn't want to get busted breaking the rules.  

Then they left a nasty review which detailed things that did not happen (actually, a couple of things that literally could not have happened).  Upon investigation of his other hosts, this renter has done the exact same thing at other houses, and several times within in the last year alone:  he breaks rules, smokes, has pets, trashes the house top to bottom, then leaves inaccurate and negative reviews so he can get his money back.   He said in his review that he attempted to contact Airbnb about his "issue" but they never returned his calls or messages; Airbnb says they don't have records of this.  And, even though he stated in his review that he stayed much longer than he did (and therefore supposedly was ignored and inconvenienced for a long time) and Airbnb's facts, again, state otherwise, his review is allowed to stand despite obvious lies.

Airbnb says that despite the guest's written history of his exact same continuing BAD behavior, they can't prove he did anything wrong or that his review is inaccurate or inflammatory. Airbnb won't take the many hosts' many words for it.  So the hosts lose their rental money, don't get their deposit for the damages, we personally got our first bad review ever, and Airbnb does nothing to stop this guest from robbing their hosts over and over again.

And like others here, more than once as a guest I arrived at one of their rental properties only to find out the host had canceled last minute, or it was a fraudulent listing, and Airbnb did ZERO.   It is amazing to me how they sided with the hosts then, and this time they are siding with the guest . . .  follow the money

header: Customer support is an absolute joke
body: Customer support is an absolute joke. I locked myself out of the accommodation with no possibility to contact my host and they did nothing to help me out. Just lost of bull****. They called me at 23:00 to see if I managed to enter the property on the phone that was locked inside the flat... For real? I did deal with bad Cs in the past but this is the worst so far. You should be ashamed.

header: NO HELP
body: We did hounestly described our issues with host in Krakow, ul. Sławkowska 6a/8, in a negative review, supported by multiple pictures. We just wanted to help next airbnb clients. The host retaliated us submitting a fake negative review on us  using legal words like blackmailing. I asked to remove his review as inappropriate and retaliatiated and airnbn refused. Apparently, they worry only about money. Next time I will use booking.com.

header: Cancelled by Airbnb!
body: I have been cancelled by Airbnb. Apparently it is because there were inaccuracies in my property listing. I responded that I have never even tried to list a property but they refused to investigate - implicitly branding me a liar

header: I rented a house in Spain aprox 3…
body: I rented a house in spain aprox 3 months upfront. Paid all based on AirBnb guideline. I received a Whatsapp message from host 1 day before my trip that the property is canceled. I had to make alot of phonecalls with client support and badically i wad on my own with the host even if I paid airbnb for the service. I was really disappoibted on how they handled the case. I received only a full refund and by that time all proprieties where double in price so the refund was not helping at all as I needed a proprety to stay. That was the reason why I booked months upfront. Disappointed and I will not use again Airbnb platform.

header: SEXIST REVIEWS ARE OK ACCORDING TO AIRB&B
body: I contacted airb&b regarding a sexist complaint against a host and  lies regarding the amenities. The host said he had an oven and he didnt and when i said the microwave could do with some instructions i was told HOUSEWIVES SHOULD KNOW HOW TO USE A MICROWAVE. I complained to airb&b and they said its ok to leave a comment like that and its ok to lie about having an oven. I feel completely let down and will not be using them again. They are only interested in making money not actually helping anyone

header: Does not feel safe to book when travelling with small children
body: A warning to reconsider when booking airbnbs when travelling with small children. Our family of three, which includes our 3 year-old son, have just had our Airbnb accommodation cancelled 3 days prior to our arrival (we are on a longer road trip). We are now facing accommodation costs far exceeding our original budget (it is double and very much outside our family budget). Airbnb defends their host's right to cancel us, if he sees a better business opportunity with other customers, but does not offer to cover the extra costs we now have to endure as a consequence of this 'freesom'. Instead, they suggest  'booking in a different and cheaper town' or wait another 24-48 hours and see if something cheaper turns up on our destination (so till the day before we arrive with our young son). In short, Airbnb has no interest to take any responsibility for an issue created by one of its hosts, and would rather leave a family with a small child on the street, which has made me feel really unsafe reg. Future bookings.  I have been a loyal customer and host with Airbnb for years, so I am sadened, that this is how their business has developed; from empowerment and accessibility, to corporate and inhumane business.

header: Charged $60 cleaning fee to ONLY wipe down shampoo
body: Host charged $60 for a cleaning fee which Airbnb confirmed was used ONLY for wiping down shampoo in the shower. Host complained that we didn't follow checkout instructions that were at the back of an unmarked folder sitting on the dining table even though we agreed to and followed all rules laid out in the Airbnb listing when we booked, turned off all lights and electronics, left the place tidy, put rubbish neatly inside rubbish bags and closed the bins, washed our dishes, locked the door, put the key back into the lock box and scrambled the code. We should not be subject to negative reviews from our hosts for not following their checkout 'rules' that are arbitrary, not disclosed prior to booking, and can just be chucked into the back of an unmarked folder. It is not our job to do anything further than what we had done which was take adequate care of and respect the property, leave the place tidy, and account for security (i.e. locking up). Outrageous and greedy host which Airbnb did nothing about.

header: The worst customer support experience ever. I lost my money
body:
In short: Airbnb blocked my account, cancelled my booking and never returned my money.

I was trying to book a place for me and my friends for our September trip. During the payment I got an error, but everything was alright with my debit card. I contacted support at night. Next morning I saw that my account was blocked but I still could see the messages coming to my account (but I could never reply, error was popping up). 
I got a message that my previous booking (which I had for my solo August trip) is canceled. So I tried to contact support once again but I couldn't as my account was blocked and I couldn't send messages.
After several days I got a message that my account will be removed and I won’t be able to create another one. FOR NO REASON.
My booking was canceled and they are not going to refund me. They sent a page where it's said that if your account is blocked you won't receive any money back. HUGE SCAM!
No one explained me the reason, I didn't break any single rule. I have only positive reviews from hosts and no issues at all. Now they're ignoring me.

header: Terrible experience
body:
I reserved a very large house in Washington DC for my son,s upcoming wedding. Reserved in April. Dates were for july 31 to August 5. On July 22 the "Host" Marshall of the "Bloomingdale 4-BR Homestay/Rooftop + Parking" listing emailed me that his house was no longer available 9 days before the event. I tried to contact him but he stonewalled me on Email. I contacted the company and allegedly he said he thought we were going to have a party in the house. I'm 66, we're bringing the grandkids. There was no mention of a party. The customer service tried to contact him and he stonewalled them too. They said they were going to credit back all charges but that has not happened yet.
Terrible experience, very unprofessional. Would never use them again

header: Actually less that a 1 star
body:
Actually less that a 1 star but I don't get that choice.
Booked a cabin in Pigeon Forge "Wooded Bliss" in mid June 2024, paid the requested deposit with travel insurance and received a You're all set confirmation" email on June 15th.  On July 17th I open my emails to find that my reservation has been cancelled and I was getting a full refund.  I have no idea what is happening.  I look on the site and the cabin is again free for my time frame and the price is roughly $250.00 higher than quoted  and scheduled to me.  I email Airbnb and the Host and one or the other tells me that there was a glitch in the system and the price was quoted to me wrong. LOLOLOL and it took you over a month to figure that out.  I was told that they could not change to rates to accommodate me but they conveniently were able to rate change to benefit themselves.  This absolutely should be illegal to be able treat people like this.  Airbnb customer service HA what a joke.

header: Don't care about fraudulent payments
body: I noticed a fraudulent charge on my bank statement for $1900 on my business account from someone booking an airbnb. I always use PayPal to pay for my stays so I knew something was wrong. I contacted airbnb and was told maybe some family members or friends used my card, smh like I really would let someone else hold my one and only business debit card. I asked them to just please cancel the reservation so the money could go back on my card. I was told I couldn't cancel the reservation cause my name wasn't listed on the booking(anyone with common sense can tell this is fraud,my bank card used without my consent and a whole different name and email on the booking). I stayed on the phone with customer service over an hour trying to get them to see that this is fraud. I even sent a screenshot of the charge and confirmation number listed on my bank statement to them. Why not just cancel the reservation and my money go back on my card and the individuals that used my card fraudently wouldn't get a free stay but instead after what suppose to been an thorough investigation all I get is a message stating that maybe a family member or friend used my card. They don't care about fraud and it is not taken seriously..

header: Avoid Airbnb it is not a safe platform…
body: Avoid Airbnb it is not a safe platform at all. I was a superhost for 2 years before I ended up cancelling my account and all booking. I really hope to see this company go bust.

header: Stay away from this one....
body:
We booked a condo based on the photos for Frisco, CO, Unit C....but...
- black old in bathroom
- ripped, smelly furniture
- spackled and dirty drips on walls throughout
- had to buy Drano to unclog bathroom sink
- no 'deck' 
- not even a mattress pad on the bed!

Please stay away from this one

header: Do not believe the reviews
body: Do not believe the reviews. Stayed in Marie’s place in Aix en Provence France. She had 4.8 stars. Pictures of view were untrue. Didn’t mention you had 42 steps in a dirty old hallway with poor lighting. Had a bathroom with a small toilet up 2 high steps that had no rail or room to move. Had damp towels that were worn thin and you only had one towel each to use. No extra linen, pillows and very poor quality bedding. Furniture was so cheap and inexpensive quality that felt it would break if you moved it. Cheap shower gel and no shampoos etc to use. Big issue she had no hairdryer and and when asked she was so damn rude and cheeky about this. Wish I had cancelled and air b&b lie about these reviews. Please avoid if you come across this awful place

header: Amazing experience
body:
Amazing experience. I started with very high expectations and yes finally I am one of the best host. I would like to share a code with you for both earn £40
Here we are
www airbnb.co. uk/r/shul91?s=13&t=0d1c0j
WELCOME TO THE ADVENTURE

header: We booked accommodation 7 months in…
body: We booked accommodation 7 months in advance for this  July 2024 and paid in full at the time of booking. On the day of arrival the accommodation was cancelled and alternatives offered costing £2000 more.

header: AirBNB BEWARE
body: AirBNB is a joke of an orgisation. Would never never deal with this money grabbing company that hide behind texts. Would love to find out who regulates this company ?

header: Charged £550 for fraudulent ‘damages’ claim by our host
body:
We stayed at an AirBnb in Italy (lake Comp) and paid £3,000 for the privilege. On arrival, the accommodation was utterly filthy with mud from shoes in the drawers, hairs everywhere and dust on the surfaces.

We reported this, firstly to the host and then to AirBnB. The host failed to resolve matters (having initially promised to refund our cleaning fee). AirBnB then subsequently failed to take any follow-up action.

In response to our complaint, the host submitted a claim for £550 of ‘damages’, which we are now being pursued for, and which we totally refute.

Needless to say, we will never book with AirBnB again.

header: What is Airbnb playing at??
body:
I like Airbnb but there are some HUGELY irritating features.

This is a new one but it has become annoying very quickly.  I open up a wishlist and up pops a window inviting me to share it - and every single time I move off the wishlist page and then return (or do anything else), I am asked if I want to share the wishlist - I DO NOT WANT TO SHARE THE DAMN WISHLIST, STOP DAMN WELL ASKING ME!!  How many times do I have to click the "x" button to close this window down??

Also, if I put in a specific location where I want to search, I get pages and pages of properties which, on the same one page, range from 2 mins walk away to 30 mins drive.  Why not have the first page with the closest properties and then subsequent pages move further away?  Instead, I have to wade through pages and pages of places which are of no interest to me: if this is a marketing ploy, it is a waste of time.  I am NOT going to choose a property just because it turns up on page 1 or 2 of a long list!!

header: Worst company in the hospitality industry
body:
In term of the guest support, airbnb is the worst company in term of the hospitality. My numerous experiences tell me that airbnb outsources support to India therefore the goal is one and only: take every penny from its guests!
Use hotels, booking dot com or other travel sites, at least they will help their guests!

header: DISASTROUS is how I describe my…
body:
DISASTROUS is how I describe my experience. A group of friends booked a 3 bedroom in Queens NY for two nights traveling from Canada.  When we got to the location the apartment was nothing like advertisement, the 3rd room was a space in the living room separated by a bookshelf, the shower curtain was torn and dirty, the bath tub was so messy it had morass growing on it, the entrance mat was caked with dirt and parts of the floor had thick dirt sitting on it.

I called Airbnb and complained, after driving for 9 hours they told me all they could do was refund me my fee paid and $100 coupon to help me to book somewhere else, note this was a Friday evening, they themselves couldn’t find anywhere at last minute offering 3 rooms for the rate I paid plus $100 coupon.  They offered to increase the coupon to $200 when they themselves couldn’t rebook our reservation with any other host and me complaining and fussing with them for at least 3 hours after arrival.

Accepting the $200 coupon and receiving the reimbursement fee would mean we still had to pay $500 USD in order to secure somewhere to sleep.  After going back and forth with customer service support up to 1:30am Saturday morning still no resolution because they decided they cannot assist further.

At 2:30am they cancelled the booked reservation still with no resolution to our accommodation, approximately 7am I called them again to find out how do we move forward, they again offered a $200 coupon this time since they had cancelled the reservation this was to be used towards further booking, I told them I will never be booking with them ever again and they were like “ok but we can’t compensate the $200 no other way.

That was the end, so with all the trouble we went through all was received from Airbnb support was a cancelled reservation and my money returned they didn’t care where we slept, or how we managed throughout the night after trusting booking through these people.

IF YOU DON’T MIND BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE WITH NO ASSISTANCE WHEN YOU TRAVEL OUTSIDE OF YOUR HOME TOWN/ COUNTRY NO HELP IF YOU GET STRANDED, POSSIBLE FILTHY ACCOMMODATIONS, STRESSFUL NIGHTS BECAUSE OF MISLEADING ADVERTISEMENT AND NO COMPENSATION FOR ALL YOU EXPERIENCE “BOOK WITH AIRBNB”

header: Horrific customer service, untrustworthy
body:
Horrific customer service. Do not action any issues with let down hosts/owners as they are just money grabbing.
Recent stay in totally unsafe villa with multitude of maintenance issues, exposed wiring, sharp objects in the bottom of pool, ceilings peeling off. The issues were brushed aside by owner and nothing was done by air bnb after several requests to resolved the matter. Was totally ripped off. 
Will be recommending to all friends and family to avoid using Air bnb at all costs. Can’t not be trusted.

header: First stay…
body: First time staying in an Airbnb- decidedly less expensive than a hotel. Of course there’s no continental breakfast as you’re on your own when it comes to your first meal of the day; but certainly the amenities far exceed your typical hotel room which is generally blasé.

header: Most overpriced website for what you…
body: Most overpriced website for what you receive that I've used in a long time. Place I stayed at made me feel unsafe. Does this company review their hosts?

header: Atrocious customer service with little resolution
body:
This nonsense about ‘lead guest’ is ridiculous. Hundreds of companies have admin staff who book rooms for their employees whilst on business.
If there is an issue with the accommodation, then you are forcing the person staying at the bnb to relay the issue to their admin person who is not involved in the stay.
It took you the entire length of the stay - a week - to refund a laughably low percentage of the cost of the stay. We needed the problem solved, not a paltry sum as a placater; £27.75 out of £1110.
Also, stop with the pre-written auto responses. You have a score of 1.3 out of 5 on here of over 13,000 reviews. What does that tell you? If another business comes along and overtakes you with a similar model, don’t be surprised. You should be working hard to get to a score of at least 4 out of 5. Your policies and your quality of customer service needs a serious overhaul.

header: Airbnb host reviews are false!!
body: I booked an apartment in Budapest hungry with Airbnb, the host turned out to be the biggest most arrogant cheap I have ever encountered, The amenities stated in the description included. Toiletries, we had the place booked for 6 day, But the host supplied enough toiletries for about a day and a half. After we ran out of toilet paper the host recommended we go by our own for a 6-day stay. We wrote a truthful review about the place which his photos do not accurately depict the reality of how the place was + we also noted what a terrible host He was, he would water down his soap containers, and when you ran out from using it, he would tell you to go buy your own. Needless to say, Airbnb refused to allow the review, stating it violated their review policy. Which was a lie. They use that excuse to make one of their apartments look good. Airbnb does not protect people like us. They are only it for the money and they will side with a host as long as they can keep making money off of them. Stay away from this company, they're rating system is totally false, factual reviews telling the truth are not allowed to be posted, which should be posted, and they deliberately keep them from being posted so they can continue lining their pockets from innocent victims who book places like this because of the reviews which aren't true!

header: NEVER BOOK with AirBnB!  Paid over $2700 for 1 month stayed 1 night
body:
NEVER AGAIN!!!  Stayed 1 night but paid over $2700 for what was supposed to be for 1 month for a condo in Athens, Alabama. Got partial refund but still paid over $900 for 1 night.  

Horribly unclean bedroom slider and patio that was full of cobwebs and insects that hadn't been cleaned for weeks.  Though the host had told me it had just been cleaned and that happens due to proximity to river. Found out that the maintenance person hadn’t been there for at least 2 weeks.  Pots and pans that were greasy and rusted and sink that was horribly rusted.  

Unsafe due to broken blinds that would not close in the main living area so outsiders could look in on the ground floor .  Master bed hard as a rock.  Couldn’t get hot water in bathtubs.

 Had to wait for over an hour for a maintenance person come over for what the host called an “emergency” to look at blinds and water issue.  

Was told that if I wanted to find someplace else to go ahead.  I did and subsequently cancelled.  When asked for a refund I got a partial but the host insisted on keeping the $250 cleaning deposit.  I fought that with Airbnb and they did end up refunding that.  

So I received a little over $1700 back from the 2700 paid.  Over $900 for 1 night.  I could have stayed at a resort on a beach for a weekend for that!

Cancellation policy says if place is unclean or unsafe a full refund is allowed.  Been fighting that all week.  Not going to happen. 

AirBnB say that my concerns were minor and I should have contacted them before cancelling.  

Host has still refused to refund any more, including what she calls “emergency “ call out.  Emergency?  To have blinds repaired because they won’t close?  Obviously she doesn’t go to the property to check on things prior to guests arrival.

header: Another lovely trip
body: I've used Airbnb a few times and had another lovely stay in a cottage on the west coast of Donegal. The only issue was a small amount of mould in one of the bedrooms but I have no other complaints! I will be back for another stay in Airbnb soon.

header: Otters Rest, Droitwich
body: Stayed at Otters Rest, Shernall Green, Droitwich.  Air b&b was very tastefully decorated with high end furnishings. Set on a working farm. Lake within few minutes walk where you can fish. Host was very hospitable leaving a bottle of wine and cider for our stay. Would hughly recommend.

header: Disappointed
body:
We have booked accommodation in Cyprus in December 2023 to travel first week of September 2024. This booking was cancelled by airbnb in June. Reason: building management has changed and all of the sudden, it came back on offer with a new higher price. We have just managed to find something in similar condition but of course the price was higher due to less choice, closer to the journey.
Today, 19-7-2024 we just got a message about it cancelled. Reason: (owner) we have moved.
Seriously considering it’s a scam.
I’m now not surprised it’s being valued so low.
I’m disappointed. Will be avoiding airbnb!

header: Airbnb Plymouth Stoke Deluxe Mews Apartments., the property was not prepared for receiving  guests.
body:
Airbnb Plymouth Stoke. Plymouth Stoke Deluxe Mews Apartment. 
After Airbnb suggested  to get in touch with our host, I sent a message to the host Pure B, to be connected encase there was a problem on our arrival. There was no quick response for a couple of days, so I sent another message asking for response. On our arrival we faced no water coming from the taps and no heating. The boiler had issues. Luckily my husband is a building services consultant so he managed to fix it. It was not his responsibility though, as he was a guest there. The thermostat valve on radiator did not work  in the main  bedroom, so it was uncomfortably hot. We isolated the radiator to cool the room temperature at night. Than we discovered the smoke alarm cover was hanging dangerously on  cables from the ceiling. Later I discovered the late message from the host saying "Busy period" 
 and suggesting if there is a problem to " try "contact the building manager , but currently he was away. We picked the info numbers from the itinerary and sent 2 emails and left a message on the phone, reporting the issues. No one got back to us during the whole period. It felt very unwelcoming.
On the top of everything I sent complain letter on Airbnb , they thanked me for an honest feedback and never came back to us with apologies or anything.
It is a shame , because it is a nice place. We used to love Airbnb before.

header: Registering is a nightmare! Use easier company
body:
Airbnb are very difficult to try to register with. Complicated process, unlike Booking.com which is so simple. 
If you wish to save you favourite apartments on Airbnb you need to Register & it's too complicated & takes the pleasure out of browsing. Go with an easier company!! 
Airbnb I'm not impressed

header: My reservation was canceled while I was…
body: My reservation was canceled while I was on route. The reservation was paid for and done a week before. Customer service didn't reply for more than 8 days.

header: Good site for short rentals.
body: Did many stays as a guest around the world on AirBnb and everything was smooth.

header: Ended up in hospital unable to walk…
body:
Ended up in hospital unable to walk with an extremely bad sprain and unable to get on my flight or attend my upcoming conferences.  Airbnb were completely useless and the hosts were miserly and greedy- one was 2.5 weeks out and still would do nothing helpful.  
I will not be using Airbnb again in any place that provides serviced apartments.. nor would I recommend it.

When somebody is injured with medical certificates nobody should be trying to profit off them.  Even Jetstar refunded my flight in vouchers fully.  Airbnb does not have your back.

header: I can't remove my banque info from the…
body:
I can't remove my banque info from the site.
An advice will be to remove immediately credit card information from Airbnb platform if you have made the mistake of agree to save it. They can charge you without you authorization. Then it's too late because the option of removing the card will be unavailable.

header: Not Recommended - Do Not Trust Them- ABNB is a Scam
body:
I agree with a lot of other reviews on here.  Their customer service is horrible and untrustworthy.  They say one thing and then transfer cases to someone else who decides what to do.  

I wrote an honest review for a host and gave the host 1 star and the review was removed.   

ABNB is a scam. Don’t stay in peoples homes. Take this seriously and always stay in a place where you can easily get your money back if you’re unsatisfied and leave. Their rules and policies cater towards the hosts and not guests. Guests are not their priority and are being taken advantage of. I think it is unacceptable that they require hosts to be paid in FULL before a trip without guests having the benefit of seeing a property and its condition. I rented a property in Baltimore, MD a month before a trip and did not see the entire property or the condition of the neighborhood. The property was in mediocre condition and the hosts were not cleaning properly and the home was in a very bad neighborhood. The grass was not mowed. The home was located in a neighborhood with boarded up houses, torn down buildings, trash left on the sidewalk, there was a lot of graffiti on buildings, and there are some homes with the windows blown out. The neighborhood was run down. This property should never have been permitted to be on ABNB. While there, I was harassed by the owner. So, I left the property and notified ABNB that I wanted a refund for the unused portion of my stay. The hosts refused to give me my money back for the remaining two weeks unless she / they could find someone else to rent. ABNB’s are NOT LEASED PROPERTIES and should not be treated as such. It is a mistake to require PAYMENT IN FULL before a guest sees the property. Hosts are able to get away with taking people’s money, treating people poorly, and not maintaining their property. In addition, ABNB charges a fee when you use their service. I don’t like their business model and think that they should require a deposit to rent the home and then payment in full is issued once a guest ends their stay. Don’t use ABNB. Bite the bullet and pay extra to stay in a hotel where you’ll have peace of mind.

header: TRULY AWFUL AIRBNB HOST AND CUSTOMER SERVICE FROM AIRBNB
body:
Absolutely terrible customer service!
Have been an Airbnb member and never had to complain about a host. 
Stayed at a house which was dirty, dusty and unsafe. 
Wrote a review and the host replied with untruths as upset about the truths I had written. 
Airbnb refuse to remove as “Always two sides to a story” yet the hosts was clearly untrue - told us we failed to vacate the property and still there when the next guests were due to arrive even though we were 300 miles away!
No longer using Airbnb and can’t recommend.

header: Disloyal customer service
body:
Hi guys, 

I usually love hosting people but the customer service has been very unprofessional towards me. A guest canceled his booking with me like couple of days before without penalty fee but if I cancel then I get a penalty fee. I am new on this platform and I never got the real talk how this app work etc. They have been laughing also to me on the phone when I needed help. What to do next? 

kind regards

header: Turned upto venue to be refused on the…
body:
Turned upto venue to be refused on the door of the hotel. 
Airbnb has let people set up accounts without checking them and they have been renting out rooms that aren't even there's and fraudulently making money from it.
I had traveled about 60 miles and taken day off work for my anniversary when I complained they said they will refund me with 15 days and that was it I had to travel back home 60miles. 
When I complained again they blocked my account.
Do not use airbnb you don't know who you are renting your rooms off and neither do they and are not sympathetic or understanding at all

header: Supportive AirBnB
body: I had to change my travel plans whilst I was already on holiday with a string of AirBnB's bookings lined up.  They accommodated me, repaid me either portionally or full for canceled bookings.  I also once made a booking for the wrong date and they were incredibly accommodating.

header: Booked rental year in advance, canceled 10 days prior to trip after charging full cost
body: I booked a house for rent through air BNB in August 2023, they proceed to keep my reservation until I paid in full 10 days before my trip that was in July 2024. After receiving my full payment they canceled my stay claiming the house was sold - if the house was for sale upcoming guest should have been notified prior and not 10 days before travel and after payment. Unfortunately there were not additional options in the area and several resorts/hotels were booked up so we are staying 45 minutes further from where as intended and the costs of the hotels double since being so close to our trip. Very disappointing and dissatisfying. Air BNB was not helpful after canceling and provides us option 45+ minutes from our original booking at almost triple the cost. Will not be using air BNB any longer seems they went down hill the last few years.

header: Everything was perfect
body: Everything was perfect

header: Reservation № HMZEBDF4DA
body: Reservation № HMZEBDF4DA - without my confirmation they changed the booking dates and made a refund to a card that has been out of service for a long time, even though I warned them about it. Now I am at risk of losing money. The host also did not confirm the change in the booking - they decided on their own and changed everything without confirmation, causing a lot of problems for both me and the host.

header: From super host to vagrant
body:
On vacation with my wife and child in portugal i used airbnb to book a beautiful apartment for 4 nights ,all went well and then i get a message from them saying the booking had been cancelled as i was a noise risk... even though i was with my wife and son .. the host spoke to them and explained that she had met us and didnt see what the problem was , we had already checked in ..
A further message then was sent explaining that the host was quite within their right to call the authorities to remove us from the property ...

This being said our host was amazing ..
Myself being a super host on their site , well was , as they closed my account down there and then ,
Spoiling our holiday without any thought is sickening .
I called the help centre at great expense in the uk from portugal and was explained it would be looked into , then almost instantly a new message was sent explaining that their decision was being upheld... 

We had already met our host and explained that we too were also hotel owners and also had several properties on the airbnb site as super hosts... and then our host was contacted by airbnb , can you imagine the embaressment caused by this ? Totally spoiling our vacation in portugal...

Ive worked with airbnb for more than a decade , gained super host status and some automated algorythm picks up somethinv and spoils everything,
Never had a problem with hosting or as a tourist using their site before...
Disgusting... absolutely disgusting...

header: A host entered my room , Airbnb didn’t care at all!
body:
My last trip to Barcelona ended with full stress and anxiety.

A host went to my room without my consent, after reporting the situation to Airbnb at first they were concerned about what happened even they offered me refund but I said no! I want your guarantee that my belongings are safe because even my bank account were on tables in the room!

After two phone calls, a lot of discussion guess what! It ended with no explanation and even they declared that the host didn’t break their rules entering my room while I have checked in and left my stuff there!!

They were very unprofessional even closed my thread chat many times, pushing me to be silent. From now on the Barcelona host is open handed to do whatever she wants and it may bring harm to future guests because she saw how Airbnb is careless about me!

I still don’t understand why they were so nice on phone, they were saying if we were you we would be more stressed but after wasting several days they ignored me with no explanation 
Case A23301875

header: Censorship by Airbnb
body: On June 28, 2024, I had a reservation via Airbnb in Madrid for an advertised “Condo” which in reality was a very uncomfortable attic. At the last minute, I had to add another guest and was charged an extra 35 euros per night (105) but didn’t get anything extra like sheets, blankets, pillows, or anything else except an uncomfortable couch. When Airbnb asked to write a review about the place I did, describing the situation. Days later, Sara, from the company told me that my review was removed because it was biased and retaliatory.  I have to say that I am truly disappointed and feel insulted by the idea that I wrote that kind of review about the host and his deceptive add about the “condo.” The fact that the host asked to pay more for another person is fine, what is unethical is that I didn't receive anything extra. Airbnb is exercising censorship by removing my review and is cheating because other potential clients will not have an objective review of the attic in Madrid and will be victims since Airbnb sides with hosts instead of guests.

header: I’m so overwhelmed by this corporation
body:
I’m so overwhelmed by the fact that I have had the worst experience with hosting my l place on their platform. I feel so bad because my experience as  a host put to much pressure on my family and 
My husband is in the hospital rn because of the emotional distress and physical pain and hassle air bnb has put me and him through, it triggered him and he is affected about the issues I had with hosting . He has sickle cell and well let’s just say the company dropped the ball all the way and they are not doing anything to make it right meanwhile we’re at the hospital. Still have guest in our house that have not payed me for being there because air bnb is holding the payout hostage. And it’s been nothing but attitudes and unfairness dealing with this situation that still has not yet been resolved. I wouldn’t recommend hosting on this platform to anyone they are not helpful to host! Save yourself and your family the headache if I could’ve gave zero stars I would’ve not a trustworthy or reliable source. I’

header: I have booked an apartment for me and…
body: I have booked an apartment for me and my friends- canceled by host - booked another one - also canceled. 2x burned money - and still waiting for refund but no luck. This screw me up a big time. I paid for whole group....

header: Horrific customer and website service…
body: Horrific customer and website service in general, full of automated responses and when you talk to someone they're as inept as their automated service. The verification ordeal is absolute nightmare with no resolution at all I highly recommend deactivating your account and even that is a long useless process in itself. Awful terrible I can't describe what a waste of time signing onto this app was. Never again don't recommend  find another website.

header: Diabolical Customer Services
body:
Absolute shambles of a shower of shambolic shambolism. Avoid at all costs. Having had a booking cancelled at very short notice earlier this year, we secured a refund of £227 which at the time was stated as being usable against another upcoming booking we had. Now we try and pay the balance for the holiday and we're told we can't use the £227 credit. Totally appalling company, completely disingenuous in their offer to put things right. Fobbed off by customer services, I've emailed their CEO, but not expecting much. 

Do not use these cynical crooks. 

They make it so easy to complain about hosts or accommodation, but near impossible to complain about Airbnb themselves

header: Tried to sign up silly AI does not…
body: Tried to sign up silly AI does not realise that I am using the app and cannot use means to recieve code without closing the Airbnb app

header: Ask yourself why a company this big offers no way to raise a complaint
body: Like many others I had used Airbnb for years without issue. When I turned up at a property that was uninhabitable due to a flood, I only received 3/4 of my refund despite having to check out within an hour of arrival. After much back and forth, and because my credit card issuer has raised a dispute, Airbnb have agreed to refund the final 1/4 of my stay but only if I cancel my dispute first - ha, not likely! What I have found is there is absolutely no way to raise a complaint, a lot of case handlers don’t speak the language of the people they converse with and Airbnb repeatedly close down messages to avoid speaking with you. I can honestly say I will never use them again; there’s no point using them as they offer such little support that I might as well save money and book directly with the hosts. Don’t ever expect Airbnb to help you in an emergency - it took them 48hrs to respond to my urgent requests for help.

header: I attempted to work for Airbnb
body: I attempted to work for Airbnb.  It is despicable the way they make their $$ scamming thousands of people!  They don’t even try to hide it! I cannot work for an employer who is so tactless and unprofessional as Airbnb.  Their business tactics are absolutely heinous!  Anyone who has lost $$, or was charged unforeseen excessive fees should contact the Attorney General in Washington, DC (202) 727-3400: Brian Schwalb [Trust Pilot will not allow me to post his e-mail], and report the fraud and possibly start a Class Action lawsuit.  I am reading the Reviews now and know they are legitimate! If U are looking to book a hotel or car rental, STAY AWAY FROM Airbnb! Or U will most likely get scammed. Just read the Reviews…

header: Airbnb was a good alternative for a…
body:
Airbnb was a good alternative for a house with better price when it starts. But now a days, they keep increasing there price and also lot of hidden price after booking.
This time i booked a house for my family. While checkout there was an amount of 190€ which was not shown while searching. But I still booked it. Later got a mail which says there is only 1 guest and the house owner ask to ajust this. I already provided the information about the family while booking. When I update the guest information again but then it says I need to pay 210€ on top. This is nothing but cheeting. Never again with Airbnb as they are in my opinion frauds.

header: Disappointed
body: I have used Airbnb for many years now but no more after my last few days. The staff are robotic and I had an ambassador lie to me, I have put a massive complaint in and I'm pretty sure nothing will come of it. Their platform is outdated. I won't be using Airbnb ever again.

header: They are a fraud
body: They are a fraud . I am studying he to sue them . I lost a while night and lots of my health for stressing , paying securing a night stay in a city and they were telling all night transaction in process .my bank asked password all good and then nothing . All the work gome ..staying in the streets ... Unthinkable

header: Terrible customer service
body: Terrible customer service. The rep barely speaks English on the phone, I can’t understand them at all! Lost my money as a result

header: someone is using my mums address for…
body: someone is using my mums address for their air bnb and she's getting probably 5 people ringing her doorbell every week... they dont check or verify anything ???

header: My booking was randomly deems as a party risk
body: My booking was randomly deems as at risk of having a party. I booked the same day in London and my booking was refused. I called and explained I have been using them for over 5 years and many same day bookings, never once had any issues. I have never hosted any party in my life and also don't smoke or drink. After their review they still upheld there decision. I don't really care about that as I used a proper app like bookings.com but im furious about how they treated me and wasted my time on calls, all for nothing. I think they have really lost the plot with this new rule. Anyone booking same day is not automatically party host ... how ridiculous!

header: I made a reservation long in advance…
body: I made a reservation long in advance and contacted the owner a day in advance but no response. Then I found reviews for this owner citing that the listing is fake. Arbnb  should have removed it, otherwise they do a systematic fraud

header: BUYER BEWARE!!!
body: BUYER BEWARE!!!! Less than 4 weeks until our holiday and apparently company we booked with ‘have technical issues with their reservations’ and no longer can honour our booking. A booking we made well in advance which is part of a long road trip so we are absolutely stuck now. Can’t find something the same price or the same quality. And airbnb now closed our case after failing to find us something suitable and bearing the brunt of extra costs for the inconvenience. Feel absolutely scammed by the host company and airbnb. Lucky we made enquiries (we weren’t getting replies from queries from host) before we set off because we would be stuck out there with nowhere to stay. Funnily enough the dates are still available on VRBO at an inflated cost. Obviously a way for the host company (Belvilla of Oyo) to try making more money. Hugely  disappointing!!!!!!!!!  Airbnb youve totally let yourself down. Please be aware of who you allow to host on your site.

header: Someone is using photos of our apartment
body: Someone is using photos of our apartment to rent when it is not available. Airbnb appears to be whining on and on about copyright, but they apparently don't care that properties are being offered for rent when they are not available. The person advertising our apartment is not responding to anything, nor will Airbnb contact him to inquire. So watch what you book!

header: I am stuck in Europe
body: I am stuck in Europe, halfway around the world from my home in Medellin. Unable to make payments for accommodations I have already booked and no one at Airbnb support cares or KNOWS what to do. I am following the instructions from the article they sent me which didn’t answer my question and told me to contact support. It has been 3 days and not one person on the support team has provided me any support or answers. Just a major run around and multiple people telling me to do all the same things which I have done and nothing has worked. I am positive that in the history of airbnb guests that this error message has come up for some one else and that there is a solution. It appears to me that I need a much more senior person to help me. Please escalate this matter to the highest level before I loose my accommodations in Athens, Greece. I have 6 more weeks of travel in Europe and I have booked all of my accommodations through Airbnb. Someone needs to make this right and help me.

header: Refund of 1650.- still missing after 1 month!
body:
We booked the Paradiso Incanto in Lugano over AirBNB from Cristian R. / Happy.rentals and encountred these issues:

No privat parking as advertised
No working wifi as advertised
Mold and waterdamage in two rooms
Mold in the coffee machine
In gerneral not clean
Bathroom door cloudn't be opened or closed
Strip club in the ground floor

We contacted first the host who didn't care and then AirBnB.

According to AirBnB our case was covered by aircover.
AirBnB told us to take another apartment and they would refund us the money from the original booking.

So we booked something new, but never got our refund!

The support is useless, they just send the same message and close the chat!

Almost 1 month has past and we still didn't receive our 1650!!!

AirBnB claims now for almost 1 month that they can't  carge back the money nor make a bank transaction!

So to be clear: The host took the money, refuses to give it back to AirBnB and AirBnB is now scamming us or what?

header: They don't even deserve 1 star. Vile!
body: They don't even deserve 1 star. They're absolutely horrendous. And I'm angry at myself for using them. Horrific. Airbnb was a novel business model at the outset: it was a viable alternative to hotels. Now, I think they're just trying to bilk people for as much money as possible before the company goes belly up. It's appalling. I was charged 37% percent tax for a very simple 3-day rental. When I tried to get a detailed explanation of which taxes were being assessed and the respective percentages, I was taken on a wild goose chase by a call center operator in the Philippines. She put together some sloppy calculation with specious tax acronyms that didn't even add up. They simply don't care. Do not use them if you can possibly avoid it. Absolutely rotten. It's just automated thievery at this point--and they've offshored everything, so good luck getting any real help to redress your issues. It's just the usual cloying, fake, faux-obsequious operator trying to "Thank you, sir" to death. Pathetic.

header: They're removing reviews from the…
body: They're removing reviews from the platform that are not serving them. By far the worst platform there is. Avoid like plague.

header: Disgusting
body: Airbnb banns women from the app to protect sexual harassers. Be careful booking with airbnb as they still let predators rent out through the app!

header: Organized Crime
body:
I am sorry but my experience was absolutely horrible. Even worse my car was stolen :( at this location. 
Checking in wasn't nice and smooth. The code did not work to get in the building, I spend a lot of time trying to get a hold of someone, but automatic messages keep coming up.  When a live person answered (host) he provided another code that did not worked either. Finally, some guys coming to the building let me get in but immediately I noticed those young guys looked like substance abusers.  I always heard that Canada is safer than USA but believe me, it is not. Please search yourself the news how "Canada is The hub for stolen cars"  
It is so disappointing going on vacations willing to spend a few days on a new country, all of a sudden, your car got stolen.  The building is unsafe, there was nobody on the building on vacations or friendly families, it was rather intimidating. When the police arrived, they search for cameras, but they found none. 
Americans need to know that once you drive your car up there, you are target. Please search yourself, 105.000 thousand cars got stolen every year in Canada. You are vulnerable in such corrupted billion-dollar business where your life is at risk with host that are invisible.

I left that place immediately, never again!

header: Unauthorised access
body: I tried to book the property multiple time.
