Even after providing identification documents and all the required details, i was not able to book the property as it was highlighting that it might lead to unathorised party. Phone calls also not providing satisfactory answers. Finally i deleted my account.

header: Would give no stars if I could
body: Would give no stars if I could! I have over £1k stuck with Airbnb as ‘credit’ which I was not aware would happen when I cancelled my stay and had to option of a ‘full refund’. It’s incredibly misleading and apparently there’s nothing which can be done about it. I have requested to cancel my account and have my credit refunded to my bank account but customer service say that the Airbnb policies mean this can’t happen. This is such a dishonest way to run a business. Would not recommend.

header: Disgusting filthy Cottage. Myself and three guests stopped in…
body: Myself and three guests stopped in Whitby Rosies Retreat Cottage through Airbnb. We arrive late Friday evening with booking ref and 24/7 emergency phone. firstly we could not find the key box to get the key. The office was closed and also repainted so nothing to say where the key box was situated. Called the 24/7 phone number which promptly went into voicemail. after half an hour on the roadside we managed through a neighbour to fine the office and get into the property. As we were all hungry we dumoed the cases and went out for late dinner. The next two days we were on a tour so did not take a proper look around. I have got an old android phone so unable to get airbnb up on my phone, so I went to Yorkshire cottages and reported the bad conditions to them. There was Mould, Cracked Tiles and broken shower and black dust on all the skirting boards and in the wardrobes. The outside space was approx 6ft by 2ft in the yard not enough room to sit and chill with friends. The towels smelt of dirty dish cloth. one of my guests ended up with 10 flea bites and we didn't even have a dog. I took my complaint to Airbnb and they offered me a paltry amount not even a third of the holiday fee. I am disgusted as they did not take into account the lack of tech in contacting them as Yorkshire cottages told me they were the management and Airbnb was the advertiser, but because we went through Airbnb the buck stops with them.

header: Would not allow us to book a villa for…
body: Would not allow us to book a villa for 10 people as we were apparently a risk for "unauthorised parties". Why have a villa for 10 on the site if you cannot book it? Customer service were useless and didn't listen or answer any of my questions as to why we were getting flagged for this.

header: Libel review allowed by airbnb despite evidence
body: Ah I absolutely understand why Airbnb has an average of one star now. We were asked to bring supplementary cash for a cleaner. We paid as we were scared of losing our reservation one week ahead of the time. When we then contested a false accusation received by message the host provided a terrible review with false accusations. Despite providing Airbnb photographic evidence they were unwilling to take action.

header: I just started as a host a little over…
body: I just started as a host a little over a week ago and the CS is HORRIBLE. I wish there was another option  for rentals. I wish VRBO had more foot traffic b/c I would change in a heart beat. If I am paying this much out to them for doing nothing ( as a host) I at least expect decent customer service. Not Impressed at all. They obviously do not train their reps b/c they have not answered ONE of my questions yet. They open a  case for the simplest questions. I then have to go all over the site to figure it out myself.

header: Worst and most useless customer service…
body: Worst and most useless customer service in the industry. Even worse than booking.com, which I didn;t think could be toppped.

header: Dishonest policies
body: We needed to change our reservation when we arrived at the property and a portion was closed for renovations. We were refunded for the nightly rate, but per Airbnb policy taxes and fees are not refundable. In this case that means we paid $228 taxes plus $176 service fee ($404 total) for a stay that cost $276, so 146% taxes and fees. This is unreasonable - we will not be using Airbnb in the future.

header: Extremely terrible customer experience…
body:
Extremely terrible customer experience from A to B. This is the first and last time I will use them.
A lot of facades and PR faces to show how they care but in reality they dont care.

header: Host canceled our stay 3 weeks before…
body: Host canceled our stay 3 weeks before arrival. As it’s peak season all the other options trippled in price. Airbnb only gave us a 25 euro voucher as compensation. Terrible service, it takes 12 hours to respond to a chat message. This makes me very weary of using their platform again. Think twice before booking a place that seems affordable. It might end up costing you a fortune if you book through airbnb and the hostel cancels. Most decent hotels will at least come up with better solutions.

header: THEY ARE SCAMMERS
body:
THEY ARE SCAMMERS, BE AWARE!!! THE COMPANY DOES NOT CARE FOR ITS CUSTOMERS!!!

An airline flight was cancelled, we contacted them due to a change of the flight, which had nothing to do with us. It was something that was told to us by the airline the day before the flight, and around 1-2 days before our arrival to the Airbnb was scheduled. We contacted them immediately, I spent 5 hours on the phone with them explaining to them the problem, the service team had no idea what they were talking about. Afterwards I had to tell them we had the right to cancel, since Airbnb supposedly had a cancellation policy in these circumstances. Then they told us they would only contact us through the app and not through email, sketchy business, and not only this, but they told us to also not cancel the booking since they would do it on their end and no charges would be made. Airbnb took 3 days to get back to us and they ended up saying they decided not to cover us, and didnt give any real reason, they didnt even want to comment on the so called policy they have in their terms of service. We ended up losing all the money, and the full 400 Euros were lost.

WE ARE NEVER USING THIS SCAM OF AN APP AGAIN!

header: Airbnb fails to assist victims….,again
body: Airbnb host deception is rampant.  We booked an Airbnb in Forrestville, California. The host accepted our funds and contract THEN the day before we were to arrive the host booked another tenant in the space we paid for and demanded we pay her an additional  $200 to stay in her other space which she was an upstairs “3 bedroom with a sauna and yard”.  When our son in law arrived to stay because he had to eat and be up at 5:00 am in preparation for work, the upstairs 3 bedroom was a hot mess, didn’t have a mattress in the 3rd bedroom, did not have the outdoor furniture shown in the and photos, and did not have a sauna she claimed it had to deceptively pressure us at the last minute into paying her more for a 3 bedroom with a sauna we had not agreed to rent let alone pay her more to do so.  Hosts get by with this deceptive and illegal behavior because Airbnb fails to honor its guarantees. Airbnb uses overseas call centers with people who are unable to help or speak English clearly who are trained to say we will help andwill call back in 15 minutes while leaving travelers in danger.

header: Not remotely surprised to see 1*reviews
body: Not remotely surprised to see Air bnb has 1 star review. They allow hosts to post libellous reviews about guests who dare to mention that they are unhappy with, for example, building works causing noise and disruption at a location promoted as an idyllic country getaway. Very poor customer service. And poor resolution to concerns that are voiced. Unacceptable to allow hosts to post negative reviews regarding people that they called ‘very pleasant’ and ‘left the place immaculate’ when they pretended to be accommodating to concerns whilst we were in residence.

header: Theft
body:
We booked our stay via Airbnb at Via dei Servi, 9, 50122 Firenze FI, Italy in December of 2023. 

The day we arrived, in the evening, while we were out for dinner, someone had broken into our place and stolen cash, makeup, shoes, shampoo and conditioner. 

The host returned our money, Airbnb did not reprimand the host. 

Becareful when you are renting an apartment on this street.

header: Nightmare Casa Via Mi
body:
Nightmare Casa Via Mi, Genova

After a 12 hour flight to Nice, renting a car and driving to Genova for our first AirBnB stay in Italy, we found ourselves within blocks of the apartment. However, the host would only text us the same information again and again. We already had written directions from him as well as from our GPS, but these didn’t help. Both of these directions kept taking us to places 2 or 3 blocks from the actual apartment.
We were to arrive at 7:00PM but by 9:00 we found the building and parked in the back of the apartment so I wouldn’t have to drag suitcases blocks from where we parked.  We texted them that we were outside and would like some help with the bags.  The room was on the 5th floor, which was never posted in the description, nor did it mention that they were on the corner of a busy street that had no available parking.  At 10:00 we called Air BnB and one agent said she would call them and explain that we needed help.  We never heard back from Airbnb or the host.  We called again and another agent told us the same, “I will call him and call you back. It was now 12:00 midnight and didn’t hear back from either agent or the host so I drove off to find a hotel. It was then we received a call from the second agent telling us that they canceled our reservation.  Please note that the host/Airbnb cancelled us, we did not ask for a cancellation. We were told that our payment for 2 nights would NOT be reimbursed. However, the Airbnb agent communicated that AirBnB would reimburse us for the hotel up to the price of the previous room. We have yet to hear from them. Up until the time we arrived, we texted back and forth with the host. The host told Airbnb that he didn’t get our texts and didn’t know that we had a problem! Obviously this was not true because the host responded to our texts with the same question, “Where are you?” When using Airbnb communication is so important, yet the host refused to call us and would not give us a number to call him. I am on heart and G/I medication and spent two days in the hotel room in bed trying to recover from this needless ordeal.
I have used Airbnb throughout the years and have never experienced such an exceptional lack of customer service from a host or Airbnb; nor will I ever use the website again.

header: Stayed at a beautiful Airbnb in NYC…
body: Stayed at a beautiful Airbnb in NYC last month. The host was incredibly accommodating and the apartment was spotless. Great location too! Will def stay here again.

header: I am very disappointed with this…
body: I am very disappointed with this company. I had a bad experience with one of the hostels booked through Airbnb. I posted a negative review based on facts supported with evidence. Airbnb refused to publish it claiming it was biased and therefore against their policy. Pathetic, I don't recommend this company.

header: Disappointed
body:
We paid in full on booking our holiday for our 3 children and my parents. The process was straightforward and our host was polite and welcoming. She is Lindsay and our holiday was in Dorset.

Then less than a month before departure they cancel with no communication or explanation. It’s hard coping with that when not even an apology is given with the news. 

Never again will I use air BnB based on this awful experience. Their customer service is useless. Automated messages at every turn. 

We just can’t find anything available for equal value in the area we’d chosen. 

Please be very very careful using this company I’d hate to see anyone facing what we did.

header: Loosing money every day due to bug in Airbnb Experience platform
body: I am an Airbnb Experience host of 2 years with the platform, and am really struggling with Airbnb for last 18 days June/July 2024. Due to a bug in their system the thumbnail of my experience is showing but the page won’t appear and so details, calendar and bookings cannot be accessed by potential guests. I run this side of my business through Airbnb exclusively to keep things simple. I’m loosing money every day and although I’m in frequent contact with apologetic Airbnb ‘ambassadors’ they can’t give me any eta for resolution of the problem or any further details regarding the issue.

header: If I could give 1 star I would
body: If I could give 1 star I would. A guest arrived at my house 2 and a half months prior to check in just to say hello. He arrived unannounced and came to my ring doorbell. When I contacted Airbnb to ask them to speak to the guest to see why he was there they instead called him and told him to leave the property immediately. This isn’t what I asked for. They then told him I wanted to cancel the booking which isn’t what I asked for. When I called and spoke to them they 1. Couldn’t understand me 2. Didn’t give me any real answers just a formulated script 3. Told me that despite feeling uncomfortable with this guest because he hadn’t actually broken into the property I couldn’t cancel the booking without a penalty so I am obliged to accept this strange man arriving nearly 2.5 months early at my home unannounced. This company yet again never fails to amaze me. I’ve had previous issues with them when a guest smoked in my home, let my house cats out, left the front door to my house wide open and then admitted she was involved in the Birmingham bonbings yes they refused to tell her to leave. I should have iknown back then that they have absolutely no interest in host safety.

header: Never ever will use it again
body:
Never ever will use it. 
no due diligence on hosts whatsoever. We got scamed over our family trip to London(my 4 children were dreaming about their first trip to Europe). 
When I as trying to reach and file the complaint just to make sure no one else is suffering same and get help to find the scamer I was told they can do nothing. I was promised a call from senior manager who can help with filing the report and looking up the person  but never got one back.
If I only could scream to the world  so no one ever use this service as they do not evolve as company and never care of either side of equation (host or guest) it is all for getting their fees.  
 Do not expect any help or empathy  from this company. 
There are other companies to look at but I'm not advertising any  here.  Just look it up

header: AirBnB Has Lost Their Way
body:
AirBnB has nothing to offer the average guest, the company is just out to make a quick buck for themselves and the so called hosts who in many cases are just landlords with no idea how to provide a service. Their business model is setup to exploit guests who don't realize they have better options elsewhere. AirBnB wasn't always like this as a quick read of old reviews will show, they have gradually gone downhill over the years, every stay now appears more and more like a borderline scam. In recent years each AirBnB booking we've had as a family always becomes a more aggravating experience that puts a significant dent in our plans and causes us never ending inconvenience, much more trouble than just going with a basic hotel. The value to the customer is just not there any more. The customer should be the guest not the so-called host. Finally, the negative feedback I have tried providing on the platform doesn't seem to get through to anyone, they are either pushed out of public view or demoted in the listing results, a shady practice to say the least.

AirBnB has lost their guest-centric focus. I will never book a property on their platform again.

header: Absolutely terrible they are all for…
body:
Absolutely terrible they are all for hosts even their community forums there isn't even a tap relating to guests and without guests there would be no hosts! I have terrible experience of a host leaving a bad review.

We were there 3days but up early and gone doing activities only back late at night. The hosts had ample opportunities to approach us or express concern and never did and in fact could have easily done so and I would have happily obliged but it is very unfair that people can literally slander people on this, like this is a huge company and very little can do.

They stated we smoked in the chalet and we didn't anytime I smoked was outside of it never left a mess, cleaned up butts and I hike so I'm very serious about that and leaving no trace in fact during my stay I even brought little lunch bags to dispose of them in public bins in village. They had to fix the shower switch was faulty stopped midway of my shower I had to wait until next late evening to wash my hair but I caused no fuss about it whatsoever  and never even mentioned it in my review I actually gave them a glowing one and when leaving the other guest next door kept giving us dirty looks as she walked ahead to the village but our chalets weren't joined and there was sperating partition between two chalets. The hosts never reached out only time I heard of their unhappiness was the untrue reviews. I left the place spotless and even lit scented candles left windows open I did all that without smoking in it I treated it like a hotel and went outside. It's absolutely outrageous that people can get away with slanderous reviews especially if they never even reached out to a guest or approached them, easily could they live next door to it. I mean surely that would be professional or if they had concerns they'd approach guest and let them know smoking wasn't permitted outside either only rules for inside, and sign inside but nothing about outside and they even had a shell that pubs were using as ashtrays outside on the table however I never used it. It's my first experience with air bnb and I'm extremely put off. I met the husband but never the wife and yet it was her that left slandering review. They never communicated about it or asked me anything, nothing whatsoever! Would they complain if I cooked in it? I'm part of a content creator club and I really wouldnt be recommend air bnb's to the club and there's about 300 of us girls in the club.

extremely unprofessional to go about it way. To be quite honest if they're hosting years you'd think they'd be adabt in communicating with people fact I didn't make slightest fuss about the shower should have shown they could easily approached simply said if I could smoke at the gate wouldn't been an issue. They put signs no smoking inside nothing about it outside. 

Prior to leaving I even got a text instructions to leaving and even stated many thanks and hope I enjoyed my stay. To be honest I met and dealt with the husband but was wife left horrible review.

Contacted air bnb several times extremely unhelpful!!! Asked to speak to management nothing! First experience its awful and never use the site again! Another person I know also experienced the same unfortunately I didn't do my research prior. With a company as large and dealing with people you would think their policies would be a lot better, more professional and so on but no the worst! Surprised they're still operating not sued out of business!!

header: Instead of help I got blocked account
body:
I had an issue with payments—somehow, I wasn't able to place a booking through Apple Pay, PayPal, or adding my credit card details.
I contacted support and thought they could fix it within a few hours.
We talked multiple times by phone, and I sent screenshots, shared the screen, and provided all the needed info as much as I could. I waited three days, and they just blocked my account without any explanation! Great job!

Almost all customer support replies were with sooo huuuuge delays from 4 to 24 hours. 
On the 3rd day of discussions, they said they don't provide service in Zaporizhzhia and Kherson, Ukraine. But… I'm not from these regions!
I asked to call me, they agreed to call me back within 1 hour, but instead, they again wasn't calling or replying, and in 22 hours replied that my account will be blocked!
I strongly don't recommend using this service!

header: I'm surprised to see so many bad…
body: I'm surprised to see so many bad reviews. I always had great experiences with Airbnb. Easy to use and cheaper than hotels. I use them all the time.

header: Will never use Airbnb again!!!
body: Terrible!! WILL NEVER BOOK WITH AIRBNB AGAIN! First and last time.  We booked a lodge in Northumberland, this lodge was hosted by Wendy of Hemera Holidays, (who despite this not being her fault she could not have been more helpful and apologetic - praise where praise is due) However somehow another family were allowed into the lodge until the Saturday, we had booked and paid for Friday to Friday!  Bad and very stressful that this can happen and you get a phone call just as you are heading out on your holiday!!!  Spoiled our first 2 days and my husbands birthday with all the stress and having to move next day!

header: WARNING! THEY STOLE MONEY BUT REFUSED ME TO BOOK THE HOTEL!
body: SCAM WARNING! They charged my credit card but wouldn't let me book the hotel, and there's no way to contact the host OR AirBNB. They also want a copy of your passport AND that you install the app to send them video proof of who you are, in order to be matched with the passport.. This is the most ridiculous thing and the worst booking site I've ever seen! AVOID AT ALL COST! Book through Bookings.com instead!

header: Not going to use AIR Bnb any more
body: Not going to use Airbnb any more. Fed up with owners charging a fortune, check in time gets later and later shaving an afternoon at best off your holiday, earlier checkouts, asking GUESTS to remove linen bedding etc, making petty demands about rubbish disposal, asking us to clean (over and above) basically leaving no cleaning materials but asking you to do the cleaners job. no electric car charging, we are GUESTS, your bread and butter - we are on HOLIDAY stop treating us all like unwelcome nuisances to tolerate for income, who you are doing a massive favour for allowing us to stay. It’s a hotel with friendly customer service, treating guests like customers from now on.

header: Airbnb is the worst company when it…
body:
Airbnb is the worst company when it comes to customer care. I've been with them for years, managing three high-end rentals, earning them loads of money, but dealing with them is a nightmare. Getting any common sense answers is impossible. Their Superhost criteria are a shambles, their security is non-existent, and they never, ever give the host any support. It's all about making money for them. 

I'm sick of the empty, automated replies. It's impossible to get anyone with any authority or common sense to sort anything out. All you get is "computer says no" and automated answers. I am so very dissatisfied.

header: As a host they don’t give toss about anyone.
body:
As a host, I have been threatened with non payment for my guests. I had uploaded a 10 year passport but they shut my bookings initially until I uploaded a new one!! Runs out next year!! Then they said they won’t pay me for my guests!! 
I am totally appalled at their threats. What disgraceful behaviour. What a terrible way to conduct a business. I will be coming off this platform as I do not like being threatened.

header: Host Scammed us with False listing claims
body: We rented an air bnb in Sevierville TN through host dan kiv who scammed us with his inaccurate false and misleading property description. The home was dirty, unkept, description photos did not match actual property. the host listed property as new rustic cabin with mountain view-all lies. Air bnb refused to help. they constantly closed my case each time I tried to send a complaint. Host has listed this same property several times to up his ratings and hide negative but true reviews.

header: Horrible unorganized customer service
body:
The Airbnb service system has served us poorly. Our host cancelled last minute (3 days before we were due to check in). We were a family relocating and using an Airbnb to stay in temporarily until our new house was ready to move in to. I had found a listings for a place that would have space for all of us and take our pets that we were traveling with. 

Our host stated that he cancelled because Airbnb failed to pay them. According to the email we had until the original day of check in to use our “credit” which was the money we had already payed. To give them credit Airbnb called us immediately and offered to help find us a new host. The “ambassador” promised to follow through with contacting the new host we selected and get back to me ASAP (It is 5 days later and I still haven’t heard from that person).

When I didn't hear back I contacted them again. The next ambassador promised me a 20% off coupon credited to my account. The next 3 people promised me the same and I also never heard from them again. I was contacting them about every 4-6 hours since we were driving cross country and the deadline to get a new place was quickly approaching. I tried emailing or messaging the previous ambassadors with no results. In one case I was cut off and when I called again they told me my original ambassador would get back to me. In another they told me that the 20% of would take 24 hours to get approved. No one could give me a reference number or look at notes from previous ambassadors. In addition my 20% was always a different $$ amount. 

It felt like they were delaying until our time ran out to use the credit and that is exactly what happened. The process was very stressful and difficult. Their version of service is to talk to you reassuringly and then never follow through. Finally I called and asked for a refund since my credit was expiring. The agent told me it would take him several hours to process and that he would get back to me. Given my previous experience I refused to accept this and tried to stay on the line while he processed it. He would not do that and promised to call me back in 20 minutes. His callback did come within the 20 minutes and we are getting our refund but not until 8 days later. 

A friend also told me he had dealt with several last minute cancelations while traveling abroad. Needless to say we will not be using Airbnb again. 

The biggest thing they could improve is keeping notes and reference numbers as well as assigning one "ambassador" to each case who would actually follow through and stay in touch.  They could also honor their word with the 20% off coupon which has never materialized.  They have continued to contact me but no one knows the history or can help at this point.

Kate

header: Unreliable bookings and abysmal support
body: Absolutely abysmal support. They take several hours to respond to messages and flat out lie about applying rebooking credits to your account when hosts cancel at the last minute, which happens a lot because hosts are aware they can hike their prices when demand is high and Airbnb's host rules fail to prevent it. Any holiday involving an Airbnb booking hangs by a thread.

header: Airbnb service and company is the worse…
body:
Airbnb service and company is the worse company in the world.
None of the call people understand what you explain to them, they keep repeating the same thing over and over and lie about what they would do. 
They stole $3,500 as I made a reservation for the place and they cancelled. It was their cancellation. 
The informed me that the refund was issued and it has been more than 2 weeks and I have not received the money. They are saying they don't know where the money is and it is not their problem. 
They are dangerous and I would advise to stay far far  away from them  and not to book.

header: My daughter is getting married in June…
body: My daughter is getting married in June 2025 and we both tried to book a home in Yuba Juba for the wedding party which consists of 13 guests.  Our request was immediately denied as being a potential party.  I contact AirBNB for assistance and received no help.  While I understand that the potential for parties exist, it could be the same if it were 1, 2 or 13 guest.  To automatically assume is discriminatory in my opinion. I have used AirBNB in the past but will now reconsider before doing so again.  I would not recommend anyone with a large party to use AirBNB.  Thnakfully, I was able to reserve the same house on VRBO and it was cheaper too.

header: Airbnb customer service is dead end
body: Airbnb customer service does not listen. We rented an  airbnb for 3 months while our house was being repaired. The host was inexperienced (first rental) who neglected to charge adequate cleaning ($250 for 3 months). Had they charged more, we could have had insurance pay. Instead they tried to charge us a month after check out (the moment the review period expired). We have over 90 photos of checkout condition as we are experienced airbnb travelers but airbnb will not review them. We spent over $100k this past year with airbnb, but this one experience for $500 has soured us. We have never had a complaint before but assumed if anything ever happened it would be easily defended. We are very disappointed in airbnb.

header: Really bad customer service.
body: Really bad customer service.

header: Air BnB stole my money on the technicality of calling it a 'coupon'
body:
Air BnB had a 'coupon', which is a credit, on my account of £235 for me to spend within 12 months.
I made a booking for £95 and chose to use some of my 'coupon'.
The Air BnB system took the whole £235.
When I challenged this I was told that this is 'policy' that if you use a 'coupon' you use the whole amount, no matter what the balance.
And so they are expecting me to write-off almost £140 because they don't give change against a 'coupon'.
That is, quite literally, theft of my money.
I will not accept this and will, if necessary, pursue legal action.
I have demanded escalation to a senior person at Air BnB.
Are they so desperate they have to steal money that isn't theirs?

header: First and LAST time using Airbnb.
body:
First and LAST time using Airbnb.

Never used the platform before. Never found the appeal. As I am staring to travel after the loss of my parent in a car crash I thought Id travel the world for the next 10 years and use Airbnb. 

First time using the platform and it is safe to say that it would be my last. I rather sit at home until I die. 

Disgusting listings, awful, useless people (customer service)

Airbnb is what Facebook marketplace is to the Internet: USELESS

Looking to take legal actions against the host and Airbnb. 

They owe me £800 and not replying and passing me around.  

Do not use them scammers!

Avoid!

header: Unit not Suitable for 6 Adults
body:
I made a booking for 6 Adults at Peter's Unit 4 - 72 Digger st Carins North, QLD 4870 Australia.
It is very clear now that the accommodation is only suitable for 4 adults and 2 small children.
Airbnb should never allowed Peter to accept a booking for 6 Adults. 
I advised airbnb support help and they are more interested in the owner instead of the end user.
First and last time I will ever use airbnb. Extremely disappointed.

header: Not even one star
body: Not even one star. Just before our holiday host cancelled booking without reason. Worst company ever.

header: We have hosted properties with Airbnb…
body: We have hosted properties with Airbnb for several years but no more. The useless call centre staff in the Philippines can only read from their scrips and can’t help with anything. Booking.com and Expedia are so much better … use them and avoid Airbnb. They’re CR🥹P

header: Great Customer Support After Host Cancelled
body: This is purely about Air BnB customer support after a host cancelled our accommodation on the day due to an ‘emergency.’ The agents who assisted me were very good, guiding me through the process and sending recommendations for ‘nearby’ properties (one of who would get a 1* for advertising a price then during booking finding a 72% add-on for a cleaning charge for one night for three people.) The refund to my credit card also went through on the same day. However, I’m unlikely to use them again, however, purely because a hotel would be forced to find you alternative accommodation.

header: Horrible, insulting and condescending
body:
Horrible, Horrible experience and not the first time but it will the last one. 
The hosts have so many rules that it is getting ridiculous, you now book on airbnb and pay for cleaning, pay for the room and pay airbnb and are still required to clean plus you get no services, no refills, nothing during your stay not even fresh sheets for a long stay. To make matters worse if the place is not up to standard (most of the are not anymore) airbnb will basically leave you stranded no matter the time. Now you cannot even call them on the app or chat with them, you have to wait hours for a response. So is either lose your payment and move or stay at a place with cockroaches, mould, no water and basically whatever the host feels they don't want to give you, they just tell you "it has never happened before, just started now". We have heard the same phrases from multiple places, along with "we just bought a new one, it is coming", "we just called the repair man, but he is not available", etc etc. As airbnb doesn't check anything anymore, the hosts are available to do anything they want without consequences. Guests are forced to put either no review or a good review because if as a guest your received reviews get bad you may not be able to book other places on the portal and if you cancel a booking because of a big issue you cannot put a review. As of today, airbnb now allows hosts to bill you deposits or any other payment they feel like outside of airbnb and airbnb even confirms with you that you have to give out your credit card details if the host wants it. The cherry on the cake was being told by an airbnb representative that if anything happens to us at the property or with our payment then "he will be heartbroken" but tough luck if you get murdered, assaulted or robbed. At least airbnb people will all be heartbroken for you.

header: Every landlord picking the customers
body:
Every landlord picking the customers,  even though I already mentioned  that I am a working professional,  not bad guys.  So funny,  I prefer giving money to hotels than booking that fxcking picking customers landlord 
Record landlords :
Naomi 
Nawai 
Selman
Their house all in west Yorkshire 
Stay away with that fxcking not helping landlord 
Totally Rubbish

header: AWFUL CUSTOMER SUPPORT
body: AWFUL CUSTOMER SUPPORT - if anything goes wrong don't contact them they make the whole situation WORSE. Just deal with the owner of the property instead.

header: Quick Easy Bookings
body:
Quick Easy Bookings,

I booked both a shared house and an "experience" in Morroco through AirBnB. Both were good and the booking process was simple, with the option to pay later instead of all upfront.

It is easy to contact the owners and the autotranslate makes things easier. Overall, I've had a great experience.

header: Villa Cardinale Sanur AVOID AVOID AVOID
body: Absolutely disgusting experience. We booked a villa in bali over Christmas and new year. We paid for the villa, booked flights ect. We got a notification today advising it had been cancelled because the owner had taken a longer stay booking. Air B&B said this was against their policy bla bla bla .. next minute the booking is cancelled and we no longer have a place to stay .. be very careful ham using air B&B ! Call centre based in Philippines

header: Poor service like all big companies…
body: Poor service like all big companies nowadays lol

header: Bait and switch
body: I’ve noticed over the years, that the platform has allowed hosts to embellish and, at times, falsely advertise the stays. Hosts have very loose terms for condo, apartment, bungalow, etc. I’ve also noticed that “entire place” is no longer a selectable option, and when it was an option, some, if not most, were any thing but an entire place. I’ve gotten to the point where AirBnb’s are no longer my first option when looking for a stay. Being truthful in advertising will go a long way.

header: I stayed in an apartment that falsely…
body: I stayed in an apartment that falsely advertised having a smoke alarm. There wasn't one, and as it was on the 18th floor of a tower block with no fire exit and residents were chain smoking in the corridors, I did not feel safe enough to stay there. I complained to Airbnb and they sided with the owner so I stayed in a hotel and lost so much money.

header: Everything is wrong with Airbnb
body:
From my 13 months of hosting on their platform. Airbnb has no regard for their hosts who put in their hard earned resources to create the properties that the Company (Airbnb) uses to make money for themselves. They don't help hosts when they need assistance, if you file a claim for damages or extra services - the host will get a run-around and their Ambassadors will continue to frustrate your claims until you are worn-out and give up.

I had a guest who booked for 4 people, then brought 8 people and a dog that isn't even allowed on the property. I had to cancel the reservation and 18 days later and over 37 calls to Airbnb (Garbage Customer Service Ambassadors) - there's still no resolution but senseless delays, avoidance of communication and unwillingness on their part to resolve the claim and settle accordingly.  

It's just a matter of time until this company FALLS like "ROME" knowing that crooked business practices will not last forever and UTMOST LACK OF RESPECT AND COURTESY for the ENGINES that prints your currency will lead to an eventual downfall of this organization - history always repeats itself especially for those who play deaf ears to it.

header: Terrible Customer Support
body: They kept declining my booking claiming I’m a party risk when I was simply booking for two adults. I asked for reviews to be done multiple times and each time they refused to tell me why they came to that decision and kept suggesting I get a hotel or choose a private room. The support is lacking and will cost homeowners potential bookings due to a faulty system and lack of effective support.

header: Not letting me book a trip!
body: Not letting me book a trip because of my age and don't have a explanation to why. Find a other booking site if you can!

header: Excellent Service- instant Support
body: Excellent Service- instant Support - I had booked an apartment in Majorca and the Host cancelled last minute! - I used the app called Airbnb Support from the UK Airport (No Chat Bot or messaging  - I spoke to a human!) and they were understanding and instantly refunded my booking in full. Recommended

header: absolutely zero support from airbnb
body:
absolutely zero support from airbnb they just pass the problems they cause hosts around and around the support team

they have suspended my listing for absolutely no reason and keep sauing it has been fixed yet ignore me when i tell them its not been resolved. 

I DO NOT RECOMMNED THIS BOOKING PLATFORM TO ANY HOSTS. GO ELSEHWERE.

header: Never got as described
body:
Never got as described, dirty. Never in ten stays had I have a host that would lete use  what I should be allowed. And humiliated me again and again when I wanted to prepare dinner or washing clothes.
Everything renting out - it says it is available, but after writing the host turns out it is not - it really takes a lot of time to even get that reservation.
Ratings are obviously overrated as they obviously delite bad reviews...
I'm sorry but I'm done with Airbnb..

header: Greedy
body: Greedy, greedy, greedy.

header: Easy
body: Overall good experience first time using them and was a success

header: Truly grateful.
body:
I have stayed at many lovely Airbnb’s and enjoyed the world in cozy environments. Only one time it sadly didn’t go as planned. 
I contacted Airbnb’s support and they helped us immediately. Even gave us a fair amount in refund - this without we asked for it nor expected it. 

This system really works for us as guests. It makes us feel safe and proves Airbnb are ready to offer their support when it’s needed.

header: The WORST experience
body: I had the worst experience with airbnb customer service. Did not get any help even though we had problems half of our stay with our accommodation. Never book through them.

header: We rented lake havasu house and…
body: We rented lake havasu house and cancelled over 2 months in advance. Per airbd and on the owners site said we would get our money back minus a service fee.what happened owner was keeping entire amount and airbd said could do nothing about? Had to get our credit card company involved to get our money back.airbd a lousy business and will never use

header: Disgusting rules forced to apply on host
body:
Disgusting rules forced to apply host. 
They make random money with no valid ground!
Greedy and nonsense

header: Worst customer service ever
body: I experience an absolute nightmare experience with Airbnb. I have identified a serious bug in their pricing system. It could be just a bug or it may be a fraudulent activity. I have been chasing Airbnb support both in writing and on the phone for 3 weeks with no success.

header: Bad support experience
body: I am a home owner and I am trying to rent out the place. The support service can’t help me . It is very difficult and frustrating!

header: I would strongly advise not to book…
body: I would strongly advise not to book anything with AirBNB, if you try to get a refund that trick you into selecting booking credit, which is non refundable. I will never use them again.

header: Dismal.
body:
Dismal.
 A host had instantly booked with me. I then informed him about the presence of my dog ( in the listed photos and mentioned in my listing).
Guest then sent as follows.
"Thank you now, and thank you for telling me about the dog. I am not a friend of dogs, and I have a fear of it and I do not want to play or look at the dog."
This concerned me, ( my safety, guest and dog's)  however after more than one hour  of begging and repetition on the phone Airbnb would not allow me to cancel with out penalty of 25 %.
I did not know the rule had changed concerning the allowance of 3 penalty free cancellation per year if instant book is on.
I have now had to turn off instant book.  Proably an inconvenience for me and teh would be guest.
I am quite disgusted at such an oblivious approach and total disregard of common sense.
Subsequently and only because of the guest's agreement the reservation was cancelled without penalty.
This is not the first time that Airbnb have been unable or unwilling to resolve an obvious issue in the correct way. Similarly they are trying to avoid paying a host referral fee. When you try to escalate these matters Airbnb's first, second and third reaction is to block an d frustrate and repeat what has already been advised. I have then emailed  Brian Chesky which obtains a very slightly improved response, but marginal. I will now look for an alternative platform.

header: If I could give it 0 stars I would!! Worst company!!
body: If I could give it 0 stars I would!!! Absolutely the worst place to get a place to stay!!! They want to charge you a cleaning fee but then want you to clean the houses!!! Ummm no!!! I pay a cleaning fee I shouldn’t have to clean a damn thing!!!! If I stay at a hotel I can leave trash and sharers everywhere and they don’t complain or charge me more!!! And then when a host gave me a bad review because I didn’t clean the back door.. and the comforter had a stain on it( I didn’t even use the comforter) they wouldn’t take the review off. The host literally said I should clean the house before I left. I did the fish and the trash like they asked. But they wanted the whole house cleaned! Absolutely not! That’s not my job!!! The company doesn’t care!!! Worst company ever!!!!

header: Host payments with held over $2000
body: Most of the call center have trouble communicating in English and when you get them to read back an escalated email, they input the wrong information at least 3 times. Air BnB are requesting KYC documents be uploaded 7-8 times and this has repeatedly happened.Resolving issues is non existent, we have had this  issue for three weeks now, 20 emails and 15 phone calls from us has not been able to resolve. Regardless of uploading them repeatedly.As hosts , air bnb owe us over $2000. If we start cancelling bookings, we will loose our super host status and be out of pocket. Currently , Air bnb have with held $2000 over 3 weeks and this is amount is increasing daily. The air bnb guests we have hosted for the last three weeks have been for free and we do not foresee payment in the future.

header: Closed my account
body: Closed my account.  Canceled my reservation and refuse to refund!!!  Customer service is terrible.  Understand at call center is atrocious.

header: the support team doesn't care
body: the support team doesn't care about customers. I never use their app again.

header: A pretty good user experience
body:
A pretty good user experience, this is my first time using Airbnb, it was fairly simple to navigate the site but is getting to be a frustrating experience.
The charges are somewhat ridiculous though, I understand you have to make money but seriously $600 for a platform fee?

header: Awful Customer Service throughout, Avoid!
body:
Arrived in California after an 11 hour flight to learn our AirB&B had been cancelled because of a flood (although not entirely AirB&b's fault). This was a blatant lie as we have family over there who arrived at the house to find another family living there for more than 2 months with no sign of them leaving anytime soon. 
AirB&B offered no support at all leaving us to find alternative accommodation on the evening we arrived. We told them we needed a 5 bedroom house as we were travelling with 9 people including a 2 year old child. 
They kept offering us 3 bedroom houses that would not accommodate us for extortionate prices. Eventually, again with no help from AirB&B we had to book 3 separate houses to accommodate us for our 2 week stay costing us over £800 more than expected.
After many phone calls, messages and emails back and forth with AirB&B they said there was nothing they could do for us. After coming home from the holiday we have tried and tried again with AirB&B to try and get some compensation, with them orignally telling us they cant offer us anything as our stay with them had officially ended (not once did they mention this while we were complaining in America). 
After a bit more back and forth they reluctantly offered us £250 back which we have refused as we are holding out for all of our money back, however this was only after we threatened legal action against them. 
We also tried to submit a review on the host that caused us all the hassle however AirB&B removed this saying it didnt meet their review guidelines as we did not actually stay in the house (we never had the option to stay even if we wanted to). 
As of today we are still in communication with them trying to get reasonable compensation for all the stress and hassle. 
The most astonishing thing about this is the original house that we booked is still on the AirB&B website letting other customers like ourselves book it with them knowing fine rightly there is another family staying in it. Crazy!

header: 3 times my booking has been cancelled…
body: 3 times my booking has been cancelled prior to my stay leaving me and my family in the lurch.  AirBnB have offered a voucher as compensation but as it is so close to requiring accommodation the cheapest available is almost double the previous cost and the difference more than 20 times the offer value.  They will be my last choice in the future as they are so unreliable.

header: Terrible company
body: Terrible company. I tried to booked an accommodation for one night and two different hosts rejected my request with the excuse that the room was not available. It resulted to 200 euros on my bank account blocked for 5 days, because the company is getting an authorization void before you even get a confirmation that the accommodation is available…

header: Corporate Greed
body:
a full 14 days after the guests checked in and 5 full days after they left before they paid me 
i have taken off my ad with them. They had their cash three months ago 
corporate greed i'll be staying clear of this company

header: Horrible support
body: Horrible support, they will not let me post an honest dislike post about the host and my very bad experience but let the host review my post and post something on my page. Stay away from these psychopath hosts on Airbnb!

header: Horrible overpriced site
body:
Horrible place. Do not go to Airbnb. There customer services is terrible. They are charging extreme services fees. There refund policy is not promoted and just changed ( in (March '24) and they did not tell anyone. 

They are overpriced. And now they are screwing over the hosts. I filed a complaint and never heard back from them. There services fees have gone way over.

If you are tired. I would urge you to file a complaints with CFPB. what they are doing is unethical and most likely breaking state and federal laws. 

I smell a Class Action Lawsuit like Ticketmaster.

Airbnb was started so you did not have to pay these crazy high services fees. They have become what they said they were starting the business for.

Go to Vrbo.com or booking.com

Much better.

header: High service fee, but no help
body:
I have rented a room in a shared apartment for a long time, another guest rents another room, and due to a disagreement about a cockroach problem the landlord was fixing, the other guest chooses to smash a window in the house because I said we should try not to overreact. and that guest threatens me with it  broken window and a fist towards my face, landlord suggests we don't talk to each other, the other guest holds me almost hostage in the room, and of course it's not Airbnb's fault, but it's that their chatbot is useless, their phone number doesn't work, and is never changed to a  person from customer service.  when you pay over 150€ in service fee to Airbnb and can absolutely get no service and thereby not use their Airhelp.

The police will not due anything because they place it on the landlord, and now I'm forced to pay monthly rent via Airbnb for being in a unfriendly environment.

header: They are so bad- We will never use them…
body: They are so bad- We will never use them again. We lost a guitar and a lot of other things when we rented it out though airbnb and they did not care at all- We will never use them again - They do NOT have any insurance - They just say they do ! They are so big that they do not care what ever you say. Also we get answers from robot's. or call centers in India . They could not care less- So finish with airbnb. For our 4 apartments -

header: Horrific experience and will never rent…
body: Horrific experience and will never rent from Airbnb again. The hosts house had a pest issue and there were bugs all over the house including crawling in my toiletries, clothes, etc.  We just completed a major relocation across the country and had a myriad of stressful issues to contend with due to the pests.  Needed to find another rental within a few days, hire movers, and repack all of our belongings in order to get into another place.  To top it off, I have 3 air cleaners that I brought into the house from my old house and each had new filters.  Within ONE WEEK, the filters were used up (i.e., completely filled with dirt and BUGS!!!).  It was disgusting!  Not only did she have pest (BUG) issue but her house was filthy.  I realized after a few days of the horror with the bugs that you could barely see out of her windows.  They were filthy with spider webs in all corners.  We are done with Airbnb.

header: The worst company I ever dealt with
body: I booked a place for a week. I paid first class plane tickets to get there that cost me $1800. I bought a rental and next thing you know I go onto my profile and they lock me out. This is so unacceptable. I have thousands involved I had the whole trip planned out, they told me it would be under review for 24 hours. It’s been over six days. Do not use them. I’m warning you. They literally locked my account after I made all my plans and booked my place now. I gotta figure out a whole new plan.

header: Great service from airbnb
body:
Dear Airbnb Team,

As the proud owner of a property in Tenerife listed on your platform, I wanted to take a moment to express my sincere appreciation. Throughout 2023/24, Airbnb has been instrumental in connecting me with wonderful guests and facilitating bookings that have contributed significantly to my business.

Your user-friendly interface, efficient communication tools, and reliable support have made managing my listings a breeze. The exposure my property has received through Airbnb has been invaluable, and I eagerly anticipate receiving bookings for 2025.

Thank you for being an essential part of my success as a host. I look forward to another year of positive experiences and fruitful collaborations.

Warm regards,
Tim & Lisa

header: Don’t ever book through this site
body: Don’t ever book through this site, Iv had £274 taken out of my account without booking anything and the customer service in finding out where that money gone they have bounced it back to me saying you just booked something when nothing has been booked they can’t relate any reference number from transaction and no bnb has been booked basically taken money out of my account from having my details stored somewhere from having booked something years ago. No money back just basically deal with it I’d advise you not to use this site as it could come back years down the line keep watching your bank statements a company like this should not be giving these types of excuses. Stay away!!!

header: I have paid a damage deposit through…
body:
I have paid a damage deposit through your resolution centre by card before a trip to Portugal. The host has refunded this but you are giving it back to me as credit on my account. I have tried to contact you multiple times and every time you tell me this is correct. I then say that it is not and then you say you will investigate and then never get back to me. This is not good enough and I want my money back as agreed.

Your support staff are useless and avoid getting to resolution

header: I just got started on it and posted my…
body: I just got started on it and posted my listing yesterday. Its still not online though. I verified everything and they say it can take up to 24 hrs for the link to be online and working... kinda complicated to post a listing in my opinion...

header: Property reviews are manipulated
body:
Property reviews are manipulated and loaded. Clearly biased towards hosts. I posted a bullet pointed statement of dry facts and the host had it deleted.

Do NOT trust the reviews on Airbnb. Almost all properties have 4.5 stars as negative reviews are deleted.

header: Empty Promises:
body:
Empty Promises:
I had a fraudulent charge on my credit card from Airbnb. When calling Airbnb, customer service stated they would take care of this matter for me, albeit needed to follow-up with a different department where they would be in-touch with me via email. I spent over 8 hours on the phone, numerous emails and inquirers via their online system over a few months disputing this charge. Not once, was I able to talk with someone from their fraud/claims department (they only communicate via email and send form/scripted email responses). Here's one example: 

"Neethu, Sun, 24 Mar 2024 18:29:12 GMT

Hi xxxxxxxxx,

Thank you for your patience as we looked into your question about a suspected, unauthorized charge on your credit card.

Often, apparent unauthorized charges result from another person (usually a close friend or family member) using your credit card unintentionally. Our investigation into this charge led us to conclude that this is what occurred in this instance.

As a result, we will not be able to refund this charge.

We recommend getting in touch with anyone you may have given your credit card details to in the past. Additionally, we would suggest contacting any friends or family members who have an Airbnb account that you've traveled with on Airbnb previously—if you added your payment credentials on another account and decided to save these credentials for future use, this could be what caused the unexpected charge.

If you have any further questions or concerns, just reply to this message. We're here to help!

Best,
Neethu

Airbnb Community support"
No one at Airbnb would provide supporting documents showing I made a charge, reservation or other. They would not tell me the property "I booked" nor the name on the reservation. Airbnb accepted no responsibility, refused to credit my account, nor allow me to talk with anyone with decision making capabilities. Airbnb, why would you steal money from your customers? This is Fraud. Shame on you Airbnb!

header: Olá Adriano P.
body:
Olá Adriano P.
Posso ligar em Portugues para explicar a situação?
Diga-me quando é a melhor altura.
Atenciosamente,
17:15
Agora
Airbnb Support 17:34
Te escribo para avisarte de que mi turno está a punto de terminar, pero no te preocupes: mañana me pondré en contacto contigo para seguir tramitando este asunto.
Un saludo,

Amazing service - We had issues in 2022 because a GU that was advised we are a naturist place, arrived, we spent some hours showing around and at the end decided to leave with no reasons - Now 2024 we decided to give a new oportunity to Airbnb, got 3 reservations (1500€) and give us 127€ 👀….

How is this even possible??? Tried to explain and solve with CS but this is the result… they ask to call, We answer in the minute, and 15m later: Tomorrow we will call you… 
We have only 5* reviews and Airbnb CS doesn’t mean to care about…

We just reserved our homes for no money… for Airbnb actually…

header: Very inconvenient stay
body:
My recent stay at an Airbnb in Dubai managed by Frank Porter was marred by numerous issues that significantly impacted my comfort and convenience.

Firstly, the check-in process was difficult. Despite instructions stating that a Frank Porter team member would check me in, I only received inadequate instructions via message, leaving me confused about parking and building access. The complex parking system and lack of clear guidance added to the frustration. After unsuccessful attempts to contact the host and security, I was only able to enter thanks to another resident.

Once inside, the problems continued. The air conditioning was ineffective, and the old, uncomfortable mattress was only replaced after a week. Other issues included an improperly bolted security safe, a TV that couldn’t connect to Netflix, an insecure shower stand, and water leakage. Additionally, heavy rains caused basement flooding, leading to a persistent sewage odor.

Despite some issues being resolved, I had to temporarily vacate the apartment due to a leak requiring extensive repairs. The relocation process was poorly managed. The alternative apartment didn’t match the provided images, had an occupied parking space, and was in a less desirable area. It lacked amenities, had poor air conditioning, a damaged mattress, and an undesirable bathroom configuration.

After deciding to leave earlier than planned, my request for an early check-out refund was rejected. I also requested to remain in the second apartment to avoid moving again, but this was also denied. Moving back to the original apartment two weeks before my final move-out date was another hassle, with no assistance from Frank Porter. I faced the same initial issue of gaining entry to the building, as Frank Porter did not have an access code.

Despite seeking assistance from Airbnb, their support was inconsistent, and they reneged on a promised refund. This experience has soured me on using Airbnb and I will never stay in a property managed by Frank Porter again.

header: airbnb are scammers profiting from…
body: airbnb are scammers profiting from other scammers. Support assistant can tell you anything but actually nobody stays behind what they say and promise.

header: The host’s property was nothing like…
body:
The host’s property was nothing like advertised,
Tired ,mould on walls ,kicked in doors, smell of drains 
In the kitchen area ,smashed tv,broken toilet ,unusable outside space,and other safety issues.I complained got no support at all from Airbnb,and the Ambassador for the claims team hung up ,
I’m disgusted that they can get away with this.
Also they use Klarna which is unregulated third party so you can Not do a charge back,
Just look at the ratings 
Eventually got partial refund 
But doesn’t take away the bad experience.

header: Terribly disappointed in Airbnbs…
body: Terribly disappointed in Airbnbs response to a situation of panic that they created as a result of a cancellation for my 40th birthday. I had everything mapped out and planned. When I realised the options they provided were so far from the other place and therefore difficult for my guests to get to. I requested to cancel and reapply their voucher to the new option. I made the change within in an hour but they refused. I have been a great customer but now i'm doubtful of trusting a booking for an important life event via Airbnb. I would be weary. They gave me a bit of a nonsense excuse for not being able to change this. Not a great customer services strategy. I would have thought, you look after loyal customers where you have created the problem.

header: Appalling service provider
body: Appalling service from Airbnb. I had issues with a rented property and they did nothing to help me. We experienced issues with cleanliness, maintenance and the facilities in the property - I took photos to prove everything, and despite providing them, they still didn’t help. They were totally in favour of the host and not the guest.

header: Terrible support for hosts
body:
I'm an Airbnb owner.

Pros: Airbnb does bring in bookings.

Cons: They take too big a cut for what they do and are too greedy.

Support is terrible. Support does an exceptional job of telling me a lot that I don't need to know (from congratulating me on being a superhost every time I make contact [it's patronising and not helpful to hear it time and time again] to feeding me with information I didn't actually ask for), but never actually answering my questions. It's a complete waste of time.

header: BEWARE
body: BEWARE - Airbnb has created a platform that can charge people for receiving no service at all. Due to ill health we could not comply with the cancellation policy and asked for compassion. None was given by the host. The same dates we chose have now been booked by someone else. The host has received double money for our booking (now cancelled) and the next person. I am out of pocket by over £800. This is criminal. In our case they received this money for providing NO service. Airbnb say, this is the policy and it is up to the host. I feel that they need to lean on hosts more that are behaving in an unethical manner. Learnings: Never stay at a host with a strict cancellation policy. Never stay at a place with no reviews or a new host.

header: We need to talk about AirBNB. You can not trust this company. Even when you pay a fortune for their service.
body:
We need to talk about AirBNB. This is such an awful company, is no one seeing it?
Two things. 
First, has anyone noticed what a rip-off Air BNB is? Then why do people keep using it? Hotels are cheaper, plus there are plenty of short term rental sites which offer better alternatives.
Secondly, as I found out, AirBNB is not there for their customers. I don't think many people realise that you really do not have any protection when you book with AirBNB. Again though, this isn't something most people know because quite often the booking is uneventful. But I recently found out myself, I had a bad landlord (of course we are bound to come across them from time-to-time). AirBNB cancelled my booking half way through the 30 day booking - Yes that's right - I was ALREADY STAYING IN THE ACCOMODATION WHEN IT WAS CANCELLED !!! I received a message early in the morning and no one would respond all day, even to give me a reason why this was happening, until finally at night I was forced to go walking the streets to look for somewhere to stay. Yes that's right, Air BNB customer service are really just that awful! 
This is a true story. You can not trust this company. Even when you pay a fortune for their service.

header: Air BNB does not do any verification on…
body: Air BNB does not do any verification on the hosts. They do not verify what the host says about their place and once the host gets paid there’s no getting the money back if it’s not as stated. Hosts only post what’s positive about their rental but they don’t tell you any of the negative. For instance, if you need assistance such as an elevator, because you can’t go up the stairs, a host will never tell you that they are on the third floor, and that there is no lift. That is just one example of the negative information that no host will tell you. Another example is if the street in front of the host is under construction and noisy. You will never hear about it from them until it’s too late.

header: I had a very bad experience with Airbnb…
body:
I had a very bad experience with Airbnb recently in our visit at London.
Most of the property items were not working.
I complained about these and when i gave a bad review i was told that i need to pay around 200$ for the damage that we have not made.
Airbnb failed to prove that the damage was done by us.
No one would take photos of the entire house and items before and after to be on safe side.it is the airbnb responsibility to compare the property before and after the property was used.
I was forced to pay the fine for the Damage we never did. they just showed us the photos of small marks on a table and said it was done by us. they failed to produce the photos before we rented the house.
